Senior Buyer (networking, servers, storage)In this position you will be working at Maxicom Zoetermeer with over 60 employees and growing. Maxicom IT Distribution is the fastest growing IT asset disposition company in the Benelux. We are a key player in the circular economy where we buy & sell used/refurbished IT equipment. As a Senior Buyer your tasks will include:-Acquisition/prospecting new suppliers-Calculating residual value of IT products.-Negotiating buyback bids-Be responsible for your purchase orders from start to finish-Making sure stock levels are up to date and parts are complete-Assist our sales with their RFQ/WTB, getting best prices and availability to help them close deals.-Inventory management and pricing always insuring Maxicom has the right parts at the right price! Your skills:-University/College degree-Purchasing Experience, minimum 3 Years-Purchasing Experience in the following: networking, servers and storage products-Precise, analytical, pro-active and a good team player-Fluent in English (written and verbal)
We offer:Competitive base salary + commission25 holidays /per yearFriday afternoon drinksTravel to exhibitions + conferencesA fun and dynamic workplace

Your tasksTo strengthen our team in Amsterdam, we are seeking as soon as possible a full-time Project Developer Battery Storage.
You identify, validate, and develop battery storage systems for the Dutch market as stand-alone or hybrid solutions with (hybrid) renewable energy projects in the power class of 1-50 MW compliant to local regulationsYou coordinate, manage and foster relationships with regulators, municipalities, utilities, and corporationsYou perform prospecting of potential C&I customers for battery storage and hybrid system applicationsYou prepare and co-ordinate the technical development of projects and reply to public and private tender documentsYou coordinate your work with the different departments in the Netherlands and Germany while acting as a local project planer of the hybrid energy and battery storage systems teamYou create and maintain project documentation to ensure adhering to internal and external standardsYou deliver projects within budget and on time and with structured reportingYou continuously evaluate the Dutch market regarding project opportunities particularly for on-grid hybrid systems and battery storage applications, and develop strategic business plans
Your profileYou have an academic degree in engineering or an economic, technical or mathematical disciplineYou have several years of post-qualification experience in a client-facing relevant fieldYou have knowledge about planning and developing large renewable projects and ideally battery storage projectsYou ideally know the electricity market conditions in the Netherlands and respective battery storage applicationsYou have successfully demonstrated an entrepreneurial mindset with strong business acumenYou can draw upon a well-developed network within battery storage systems, renewable energy applications and energy-intensive customersYou have excellent communication, project management and negotiation skillsYou are business fluent in Dutch and English
Your benefitsInterdisciplinary teamwork in a successful and dynamic companyResponsibility in a flat hierarchy with fast decision processesAn open minded, discussion friendly and solution-oriented working atmosphereFlexible working hours and home office options
BedrijfsprofielABO Wind has been successfully developing and implementing renewable energy projects since 1996. We currently realise installations with a total annual investment of 500 million euros. Around 700 employees worldwide work with enthusiasm on site acquisition, planning, engineering, financing and the construction of wind and solar energy plants for a sustainable energy supply, and they provide operational management and maintenance.
ABO Wind has subsidiaries in 17 countries including the Dutch subsidiary ABO Wind Nederland BV based in Amsterdam.

Wij zoeken Back-up/Storage Specialisten (Commvault) bij DataManagement Professionals (DMP) Welke rol past bij jou? Misschien een gekke vraag, maar wij van DMP willen graag weten wat jij als Back-up/Storage Specialist leuk vindt om te doen.De verantwoordelijkheid nemen voor internationale implementaties? Het geven van workshops en brainstorm sessies? Het doen van health checks en het opleveren van designs aan klanten? Of het monitoren van onze datamanagement oplossingen bij klanten en het oplossen van incidenten problemen? Het is bij ons allemaal mogelijk. Wij zoeken nieuwe collega’s voor ons team in Nederland en kijken graag met jou naar welke rol jij leuk vindt en bij jou past:-       Consultancy-       Managed Backup Services Engineer-       Support Engineer
Ongeacht welke rol het beste bij jou past. Ons team bestaat uit technici die altijd net dat stapje extra willen zetten voor de klant. Daarom word je op technisch vlak uitgedaagd om in complexe vraagstukken te duiken. Als Professional Services consultant ben jij verantwoordelijk voor: De implementaties van onze back-up oplossing (software - Commvault, Cohesity; en hardware Dell en Netapp), bij onze klanten. Dit kan onsite zijn, maar momenteel uiteraard veelal remote. Ons werkgebied is georiënteerd op Nederland, België, Luxemburg, Duitsland, Spanje en Nordics. Het geven van workshops, brainstormsessies en trainingen.Het uitvoeren van health checks, het maken van designs en het opleveren van overige documentatie voor onze klanten. Een goede en nauwe samenwerking met onze (Pre)Sales, Managed Services en Support afdelingen.
Als Managed Backup Services Engineer ben jij verantwoordelijk voor:Beheer op afstand van onze back-up oplossingen van, zowel klanten als onze oplossingen in onze eigen datacenter. Wat houdt beheer in bij ons?Dagelijkse controle op de back-upsOplossen van voorkomende problemen in back-up/storage omgevingen, wat kan zijn op infrastructuur, Operation System, applicatielevel of in de hardwarePeriodieke updates aan de systemen (hardware, back-up en OS)Rapporteren van beveiligingsincidentenRegelmatig in contact met de klant, de status van de klantomgeving doornemenProactief detecteren van problemen of verbeteringenProjectmatig zaken oppakken binnen de omgevingen, waaronder bijvoorbeeld Disaster RecoveryContinue optimaliseren van processen Als Support Engineer ben jij onderdeel van ons hoogstaande supportafdeling:Het registreren en oplossen van supporttickets van onze klanten, tbv back-up oplossing en storage.Het ondersteunen en begeleiden van jouw collega's op technisch vlak.Jij bent de aanspreekpartner voor onze klanten om datamanagementvraagstukken op te lossen en hen op diverse andere gebieden te ondersteunen.Je adviseert, begeleidt en ondersteunt onze klanten bij problemen met back-up, archivering, contentindexering en opslag.Je legt contact met verschillende leveranciers om problemen te escaleren als het gaat om bugs in de producten.Jij adviseert klanten over installatie, configuratie en optimalisatie Wat voor mensen werken bij DMP?Wij zijn sterk analytisch.Gemiddeld hebben wij MBO/HBO werk en denkniveau.Wij hebben allemaal passie voor servicegerichtheid, beheer en een proactieve klantvriendelijke houding.Goede beheersing van minimaal Nederlands en Engels verbaal en in geschrift.Wij zijn allemaal leergierig en blijven ons zelf ontwikkelen op kennisgebied vanuit Commvault, storage en alle verwante zaken.
Als jij jezelf hierin kunt vinden en je hebt kennis van Microsoft-applicaties, ervaring met Backup oplossingen, dan zien wij graag jouw sollicitatie tegemoet. Het je ervaring met Commvault en beheers je de Spaanse en/of Duitse taal, dan is dat een enorm pluspunt. Gewoon een leuke noot om te delen en iets waar wij heel trots op zijn, is dat onze klanten zeer te spreken zijn over ons. Dit is hoe DMP in de markt bekend?
Wij staan altijd klaar voor de klant.Wij gaan door tot de oplossing gevonden is.Wat we beloven maken we waar.DMP medewerkers zijn ‘onderdeel van het team’ van de klant, “familiegevoel”.Professioneel, betrouwbaar, no nonsense en deskundig.Kwaliteit en veel extra service.Persoonlijke band met de klant, regelmatig contact.
Wat bieden wij?Uitstekend pakket in lijn met jouw ervaringsniveau.Mogelijkheden om te groeien (training, certificering) omdat we jouw potentieel net zo waardevol vinden als jouw huidige vaardigheden.Fantastisch team van gedreven, positieve collega’s.Een laptop en telefoon van de zaak.Flexibiliteit in mogelijkheden tot thuiswerken.We werken met een leuk team met hoogwaardige kennis over producten in ons portfolio, elke dag leer je iets bij. En kun je zowel in de breedte oriënteren, als in de diepte (expertise).We hebben diverse kennisdeel sessies, (interne) webinars die te volgen zijn, en relaties met onze leveranciers voor additionele training.Diverse neven activiteiten binnen DMP (bootcamp, sociale projecten, incentives). DMP is de bekendste datamanagement specialist in Nederland, maar zijn ook wereldwijd, een van de meest gerenommeerde specialist. Met ruim 60 specialisten verdeeld over vestigingen in Nederland, Duitsland, Spanje en Zuid- Afrika, bedienen wij onze klanten over de hele wereld met betrouwbare en kosteneffectieve datamanagement oplossingen.

These are exciting times to join our team of 60 highly dedicated (IT) professionals in the heart of Amsterdam! We stand on the verge of new innovations and business transformation. Our goal is clear! We want to be at the forefront of every innovation and market development to deliver the best interconnection services possible. To help us successfully fulfill our ambition and support our future growth we are looking for a Lab and Storage Coordinator to join our team.  OrganizationAMS-IX stands for Amsterdam Internet Exchange. We are a non-profit, member-based association operating seven interconnection platforms around the world: in Amsterdam, Bay Area, Caribbean, Chicago, Hong Kong and Mumbai. Amsterdam is where it all started, over 25 years ago. Since then, we grew to global leadership, expanding our footprint and service offerings to other locations worldwide. Even though we operate internationally today, we’ll never forget where we come from: AMS-IX is our birth name and we wear it with pride.
Overall Job Purpose The AMS-IX Lab and Storage Coordinator is responsible for handling orders, as well as inbound and outbound shipments, ensuring sufficient IT & Office equipment, consumables and licenses are in stock.The Lab and Storage Coordinator gathers required materials together with members of the Technical Teams and other internal stakeholders for upcoming projects.The Lab and Storage Coordinator keeps up with the asset registration and maintains both the lab and the storage orderly, clean and accessible. Lab and Storage Coordinator keeps track of used/unused licenses and is responsible for the renewal process.
Key Responsibilities  Shipment handling; The Lab and Storage Coordinator handles both inbound and outbound shipments, making sure the inbound shipments get registered and handed over to the correct person and the outbound shipments are announced with the shipping company and handled properly.  Stock management; The Lab and Storage Coordinator ensures sufficient stock levels of consumables and available spare equipment for production equipment, requests quotes from suppliers, places orders in Coupa, and is responsible for the RMA process.Asset & License Management; Lab and Storage Coordinator ensures that the asset management and license management systems are up to date with the latest information.Ownership of lab and storage; Lab and Storage Coordinator takes ownership of the lab and storage environment to ensure the spaces stay clean and accessible at all times and equipment and consumables locations are clearly marked for easy localisation by the technical employees.
Qualifications and Competencies MBO degree or equivalent in mechanical / electrical field of studyGood knowledge English (written and spoken) is required. Dutch is a plus.Experience in a similar position, preferably within a Telecom/ISP or a data centre or a similar environmentBasic knowledge of IT systemsBasic knowledge of used equipment (switches, routers, optics, servers etc.) is a plusBasic knowledge of required cabling (Fiber, UTP, etc.) is a plusExperience with detailed technical documentation is a plusAbility to work with P2P systems is a plus

OfferWith over 25 nationalities, we value our diversity and foster a collaborative an innovative culture. With an office located in the center of Amsterdam, we provide excellent benefits and an exciting work environment. We believe in lifelong learning and great teamwork!
Some of the perks we offer:A friendly, casual, and international environmentTop-notch hardware, including the latest MacBook, and an iPhoneDutch language lessonsYoga classesMassage sessionsHealthy lunchesAbility to also work from home if and when necessary Many tax free benefits

Einführung

Together with the sourcing team, you will run online talent acquisition campaigns and will identify suitable candidates and talents in the IT, Pharma, and Fintech sectors for our client assignments in Switzerland.

The Data Entry Operator is responsible for entering data from source documents into the semi-automated computer system or designated database for storage, processing and data management purposes.

Aufgabenbeschreibung
 Locate data elements from source documents into appropriate applications and database following instructions as applicable  Prepare and sort marketing documents for data entry as needed  Verify data by comparing it to source documents to ensure accuracy  Save source documents and spreadsheets properly to ensure it is not lost  Carry out other duties/projects as assigned

Erforderliches Profil
 Prior Windows, Excel and Web application experience  Strong attention to detail and accurate data entry skills  Ability to work independently with minimal supervision  Maintain a regular, punctual, and reliable level of attendance  Understands data confidentiality principles and follows them  Must be able to read, write, speak fluently and comprehend the English language. German language skills should be B1 or higher.
 What can we offer you?
 A thorough introduction to the professional field of digital active sourcing (research) A task in which you can take responsibility  Offices in 8002 Zurich  A fair remuneration with growing profit sharing over time

Functie­omschrijving

Werken in een maatschappelijke context. We horen je denken: dat heb ik vaker gehoord. Bij het CJIB is dit echt zo! De systemen die jij ontwikkelt en optimaliseert dragen bij aan een efficiëntere en persoonsgerichte benadering richting de burgers. Dit is wat het CJIB dagelijks nastreeft. Lever jij een bijdrage aan een efficiëntere werkwijze?

Wat ga je doen?
Als IT Beheerder Storage speel je een cruciale rol in het draaiende houden van onze complexe IT infrastructuur. Jij werkt mee aan de automatisering en digitalisering van onze kernprocessen: innen en incasseren van boetes, het coördineren van de uitvoering van straffen en het informeren van (keten)partners.

Concreet Betekent Dit Dat Jij

Jij bent verantwoordelijk voor de hoogste haalbare beschikbaarheid- en data integriteit van het SAN netwerk en haar storage systemen. Om hierin zeker te zijn van de bedrijfscontinuïteit, zijn back-up en restore van data belangrijke onderdelen.
 Hier bewaking en (proactief) beheer op uitvoert; De SAN omgeving optimaliseert in performance en schaalbaarheid; Zorgdraagt voor de juiste firmware en patchlevels van de te beheren componenten; Zorgt dat de data zo goed mogelijk beschermd wordt; Anticipeert op behoeften vanuit de business, op het gebied van dataopslag.
Harry de Jong (IT Beheerder Storage) vertelt: “Ik werk inmiddels 22 jaar binnen het CJIB, waarvan 15 jaar als IT Infrastructuur Beheerder SAN. In deze jaren heb ik veel technologische wijzigingen en avonturen meegemaakt. Ik ervaar het CJIB dan ook als een innovatieve en informele organisatie. Voor mij is het binnenkort tijd om te gaan genieten van mijn pensioen. In de laatste maanden van mijn carrière neem ik je graag mee in mijn uitdagende functie. Om jou zo die start te geven die je gaat helpen in de rest van je loopbaan als IT Infrastructuur Beheerder binnen het CJIB”.

Functie-eisen

Wat vraagt deze functie van jou?
Jouw persoonlijkheid vinden we erg belangrijk. Jij bent enthousiast en denkt mee met je collega’s. Zo zit je vol vooruitstrevende ideeën en breng je deze graag in, bijvoorbeeld tijdens de stand-ups. Dit maakt dat je resultaat-en samenwerkingsgericht bent. Hierin luister je goed naar je omgeving en ben je analytisch sterk. Omdat jij je eigen ontwikkeling erg belangrijk vindt, werk je zowel aan je vakinhoudelijke als je persoonlijke ontwikkeling en aan de ontwikkeling van het team.

Verder Heb Je Ervaring Met En- Of Kennis Van

Daarnaast ben je een ervaren IT Beheerder Storage met minimaal drie jaar werkervaring. Je bent gewend om in een complexe software omgeving te werken. Dit betekent dat je complexe upgradetrajecten zelfstandig uitdenkt, ontwerp én uitvoert. We vinden het belangrijk dat je in het bezit bent van een afgeronde hbo-opleiding, bij voorkeur informatiekunde of informatica.
 SAN netwerken (Relevante SNIA certificering); Storage omgevingen (HPE 3PAR, HPE StoreOnce en NetApp StorageGRID); Back-up en restore (CommVault); Besturingssystemen (Windows Server, CentOS Linux, NetApp MetroCluster en VMware ESXi)

Je Bent Echt Van Toegevoegde Waarde Als We Aanvullend Op Bovenstaande Eisen De Volgende Kennis En- Of Ervaring Terug Zien Op Je CV
 Kennis van NetApp (StorageGRID en MetroCluster); (SAN) storage- en uitgebreide ervaring in relatie tot VMware ESXi; Ervaring met Oracle, Postgres en MS-SQL back-up integratie; Ervaring met cloud technologie; Affiniteit met de fysieke aanleg/wijziging van SAN netwerken.
Wat bieden we nog meer?
 Interessant, uitdagend en maatschappelijk relevant werk; Goede balans tussen werk en privé; Volop faciliteiten om te werken aan je persoonlijke ontwikkeling; De functie is ingeschaald in schaal 10 van het CAO Rijk. Jouw inschaling is afhankelijk van jouw kennis, ervaring en achtergrond; Je ontvangt naast je salaris 16,37% Individueel Keuze Budget.

Optiver is a leading trading firm driven by technology with over one thousand employees globally. We pioneer our own trading strategies and systems using clean code and sophisticated technology, running a global network with thousands of high-performance low-latency applications that solve problems in nanoseconds.

Our Enterprise Infrastructure team is responsible for Storage, our Fibre Channel Network, our VMware environment, back-up systems and all Windows Servers. They are adept at taking industry solutions and customizing them to create a best-in-class infrastructure. You will help enable our technology evolution while ensuring the availability and performance of our systems.

What You'll Do
 Help us design a new storage back-end Keeping our Windows environment performing Design and configure monitoring systems for storage, VMware and Windows systems Overhaul our VMware environment Play a role in developing our backup solutions for the company Actively play a role in hardening our security infrastructure Using your PowerShell experience improve the automation of our systems Describe the environment in an infrastructure-as-code system Fixing incidents, solving technical ad hoc problems, performance monitoring and managing the system capacity Use test frameworks such as Pester and Pytest to test the code you’ve written

What You Need
 Good knowledge of Windows servers and systems like Active Directory, DNS, SCOM, SQL Server; Experience with Storage systems such as Dell SC Series (Compellent), EMC, NetApp, GlusterFS and / or Ceph; A focus on automating and solid scripting skills (e.g. PowerShell and/or Python); Configuration management tooling (e.g. PowerShell DSC); Knowledge of virtualization and networking, specifically VMware; Experience with backup solutions (like Commvault); Experience with cloud providers like AWS is preferred; Excellent analytical and communicative skills.

What You Can Expect From Us

An energetic and collaborative work culture with ambitious, down-to-earth colleagues. We constantly ask ourselves how to do better, which creates a stimulating and fun environment. Next to a great salary and excellent benefits (such as an attractive profit sharing structure, training opportunities, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, a premium-free pension, discounts on health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, weekly chair massages and Friday afternoon drinks), you will get the support and tools to develop your skills on the job so that you feel empowered to be at your best, both personally and professionally. We also provide relocation assistance.

Interested in working at Optiver?

When you apply, please provide us with a CV and a cover letter in English.

 Cultural Competency Requirements:

What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for a Senior Azure Data Engineer to join our Artificial Intelligence & Analytics Team.

About Cognizant Digital Business - Artificial Intelligence & Analytics

We help our customers leverage Artificial Intelligence and analytics in building technology solutions to improve the quality of human life. We are the market leaders in the data and analytic space with 22,000+ information & data management, AI and analytics professional helping more than 650+ customers across the globe to build and run intelligent businesses, using an AI-first, human-centric, platform driven and design thinking approach

For more information? Please visit https://www.cognizant.com/ai

About Role

As Senior Azure Data Engineer you help the team in setting-up a new scalable and secure data platform in Azure which integrates data from diversified data sources (batch and real-time). You will be working along with multi-discipline teams through the full delivery lifecycle. Focusing on complex data products and pipelines. You therefore have a clear understanding of large-scale data engineering and data science solutions. You will deliver use cases for one of our prime customers, develop practical solutions and implement them to give this customer a top-notch competitive enterprise IT Data landscape. You also contribute to fine-tuning the Target architecture with best suitable tools / technologies. In addition to hands-on, you help / guide the team with best practices, technology standards, possible automations etc. in Azure cloud architecture. This job package contains the following roles & responsibilities

Our ideal candidate
Candidate with 5-10 years of experience primarily in Cloud Data engineering, Data warehousing projects
 Experience in Microsoft Azure enterprise Data Lake platform with
  Azure Data Lake Storage Azure Data Factory Azure Databricks   Events Hub  Azure Synapse  Azure Cosmos DB or other noSQL database    Experience working in Python and PowerShell Build and deploy pipelines in Azure DevOps Familiarity with Azure security services - Active Directory, Azure Key Vault, Managed Identities, RBAC, Firewall on VNET & SubNets Extensive experience in software development in an agile DevOps environment Experience in Code management using any code repo (preferred git)  Experience in troubleshooting Data pipeline, resolve issues, performance tuning etc

Nice To Have Skillset
 Development of APIs to expose data through REST APIs  Knowledge on Big Data batch and stream ingestion (Lambda architecture) Fair knowledge of Data modelling  Good to have Azure Data Engineer certification  Agile development experience

Other Competencies
 Good communication & interfacing skills and able to work in a structured manner Strong in collaboration , Flexibility and showing entrepreneurship Eager to be open, learn, advice & implement new technologies

What You Can Expect
 Become part of the ‘flag ship’ success story - We go through enormous growth! Based in the Benelux - we have offices in Amsterdam, Eindhoven and Brussels within a European and Global network Organization driven by technology - We have a tremendous technology backbone Open, ‘can do’ team spirit Environment where you can make your own ideas reality Drive your own career Market conform benefits

Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Travel : No

Job Posting : Mar 11 2021

About Cognizant

Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 194 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

Job Description

Today, the corporate landscape is dynamic and the world ahead is full of possibilities! None of the amazing things we do at Infosys would be possible without an equally amazing culture, the environment where ideas can flourish and where you are empowered to move forward as far as your ideas will take you.

At Infosys, we assure that your career will never stand still, we will inspire you to build what’s next and we will navigate further together. Our journey of learnability, values and trusted relationships with our clients continue to be the cornerstones of our organization and these values are upheld only because of our people.

 Your role

As a Senior Consultant, you are an expert at contributing to different phases of the consulting lifecycle. You will be intensely involved in; you will define the problem, propose and refine the solution. You will also play an important role in the development, configuration and deployment of the overall solution. You will guide teams on project processes, deliverables and contribute to the proposal development, client training and internal capability-building and help detail the project scope. You will have the opportunity to shape value-adding consulting solutions that enable our clients to meet the changing needs of the global landscape.

Required
 L3 level knowledge with hands on experience in the area of Backup and Storage Area Network (SAN) for HDS, EMC and HP systems.  Experience in Patch and hot Fix planning and deployment for storage solutions.  Commvault backup setup and administration and management of backup policies  Apply regular firmware updates to infrastructures to ensure the infrastructures are ready to be upgraded/migrated as and when needed.  Routine housekeeping tasks.  Monitoring of logs and corrective actions to resolve and prevent issues.  Liaison with and take responsibility for vendor when necessary to resolve issues.  Platform Life Cycle Management  Implementation of Build Activities initiated via Small Works/Projects  Services will be provided on regular business hours

Preferred

Experience with 2/3-tier type Datacenter handling racking/Mounting and troubleshooting.
Vendor Management skills.
Knowledge of Green field /Brownfield Datacenter concepts.
Automation tools
Working knowledge with Public Cloud (AWS and Azure )

 Personal
Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include:
 High analytical skills  A high degree of initiative and flexibility  High customer orientation  High quality awareness  Excellent verbal and written communication skills

About Infosys

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through the many next of their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Job Description:
Wij zoeken

Wil je meedoen met het team van koplopers van Wageningen University & Research? Ben je bereid om als Datacenter Storage Engineer onze collega’s te helpen antwoorden te vinden op de uitdagingen van de wereld op het gebied van landbouw, gezond voedsel en de leefomgeving? Ben jij de professional die constant op zoek wil zijn naar manieren om je werk en je team te verbeteren in een uitdagende werkomgeving met uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden en mogelijkheden tot flexibele invulling van je werkweek ? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

De IT-organisatie binnen het Facilitair Bedrijf (FB-IT) zorgt met 160 medewerkers voor een goed werkende en moderne ICT- en digitale (leer) omgeving voor onderwijs en onderzoek. IT is een flexibele, wendbare (agile) organisatie met volop ontwikkel- en carrièrekansen voor IT-specialisten op verschillende niveaus. Wij zijn leverancier van stabiele basisvoorzieningen en werken samen met de business in multidisciplinaire teams aan actuele vraagstukken op het gebied van onder andere digitalisering, selfservice, security, datamanagement, high performance computing en cloud strategie.
Wij zijn trots op onze zevende plaats op de ranglijst van beste werkgevers bij niet-ICT-organisaties volgens de Computable Career Guide 2020, zie: https://www2.computable.nl/apps/career-guide/werkgeversonderzoek-niet-ict-organisaties.php

De Functie

Jij bent een veelzijdige Datacenter Storage Engineer die het leuk vindt om naast het beheren van onze twee datacenters ook werkzaamheden uit te voeren zoals het installeren en configureren van de storage en server hardware omgevingen die zich daarin bevinden. Je zoekt de optimale balans tussen stabiliteit, veiligheid en beschikbaarheid bij het uitvoeren van onderhoud en het oplossen van storingen.

Wij zijn het Multidisciplinair Team Datacenter Management & Storage Services, onderdeel van FB-IT, en zijn met 10 medewerkers verantwoordelijk voor het inrichten en beheren van onze datacenters, het installeren en beheren van een (blade) serversstorage omgeving en het beheren van de backup infrastructuur. Onze primaire taak bestaat uit beheer, onderhoud en vernieuwing van de datacenters, server hardware, storage en backup infrastructuur. Op dit moment wordt er volop gewerkt aan de vervanging van onze backup omgeving door een VEEAM oplossing, en de upgrade van onze SAN core switch infrastructuur. Gebruik makend van agile methodieken werk je in een team waarbij je samen verantwoordelijk bent voor de geleverde dienstverlening, kennis deelt en elkaars achtervang bent.

Wat ga jij dan doen?
Als Datacenter Storage Engineer ben je verantwoordelijke voor het reguliere beheer (incident-afhandeling, monitoring, changes, onderhoud, trouble-shooting), voor het opzetten, beveiligen, patchen, upgraden en migreren van server- en storage hardware.Daarnaast automatiseer je taken en werkzaamheden, maar je verleent ook consultancy en advies. Bovendien richt je de monitoring optimaal in en verbeter je die.Je bent in staat de specificaties, systeemarchitectuur en het technisch ontwerp op te stellen en om migraties voor te bereiden en uit te voeren.Je werkt mee aan verbetering van de dienstverlening door innovatie.Je herkent repeterende werkzaamheden en ontwerpt en implementeert oplossingen om deze te automatiseren.

Wij vragen

Wij zoeken een zelfstandige professional die graag samenwerkt met professionals in een agile omgeving; je bent een echte doorpakker, communicatief sterk en hebt affiniteit met onderwijs- en onderzoeksprocessen. Verder ben je analytisch ingesteld maar ook oplossingsgericht, klantgericht en initiatiefrijk en je hebt organisatietalent.
Afgeronde HBO ICT opleiding en minstens 3 jaar ervaring in een Enterprise omgeving en met het installeren en configureren van server en storage producten van HPE en DellEMC.Aantoonbare kennis van en ervaring met processen en technieken in moderne datacenters, stroomvoorziening, koeling, connectiviteit en grote storage en backup & restore omgevingen.Kennis van en ervaring met VMware, Microsoft Azure, en Powershell.Je beschikt over een ingebakken gevoel voor security en bent bedreven in het opstellen en bijhouden van technische documentatie.Je bent secuur en nauwgezet en je kent het belang van de beschikbaarheid van data en hardware.Uiteaard volg je als Datacenter Storage Engineer de ontwikkelingen in de markt en je gebruikt deze voor het initiëren van innovatie.

Wij bieden

Wij bieden een uitdagende functie met, afhankelijk van je ervaring, een marktconform salaris van minimaal € 2.790 tot maximaal € 4.549 (schaal 10) of maximaal € 5.183 (schaal 11) bij een volledige werkweek van 36 uur conform CAO Wageningen Research (schaal 10/11). Het betreft in eerste instantie een aanstelling voor 1 jaar, met de intentie een vaste aanstelling aan te gaan.

Daarnaast Bieden Wij
8% vakantietoeslag;een structurele eindejaarsuitkering van 3%;uitstekende opleidingsmogelijkheden en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden;flexibele werktijden en vakanties kunnen eventueel in overleg worden vastgesteld zodat een optimale balans tussen werk en privé mogelijk is;uitstekende pensioenregeling via ABP;171 vakantie-uren, de mogelijkheid om bij te kopen en goede aanvullende verlofregelingen;de mogelijkheid om maximaal 40 uur per week te werken en zo maximaal 204 compensatie uren per jaar op te bouwen;een keuzemodel om een deel van je arbeidsvoorwaarden zelf samen te stellen, zoals een fietsplan of het sparen voor een sabbatical;een levendige werkplek waar je gemakkelijk contacten legt en waar veel activiteiten plaatsvinden op de Wageningen Campus.Een prachtige Campus waar zowel het onderwijs, het onderzoek als het bedrijfsleven is vertegenwoordigd;gebruik maken van de op de campus aanwezige sportfaciliteiten tegen een geringe vergoeding. Wageningen University & Research stimuleert interne doorgroeimogelijkheden en mobiliteit met een intern recruitment beleid. Er zijn ruime mogelijkheden voor eigen initiatief in een lerende omgeving.

Wij bieden een veelzijdige baan in een internationale omgeving met gevarieerde werkzaamheden in een plezierige en open werksfeer.

Ons pand is modern, licht, groen, en staat op een levendige groene campus waar studenten, docenten, onderzoekers en alle andere bewoners kriskras door elkaar fietsen, lopen, werken en studeren. De campus is ruim opgezet met goede parkeergelegenheid. Je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en komt te werken in een enthousiast team van collega’s met passie voor hun vakgebied.

Meer informatie

WIL JE MEER INFORMATIE?
Voor meer informatie over de functie kun je contact opnemen met Roy Bartels, Vakgroepmanager, telefoon: 0317-489060.

Voor meer informatie over de procedure kun je contact opnemen met Gert Kreeft, Manager HR, 0317 - 481139.

Wil je solliciteren?
Dat kan direct via de sollicitatie button bij de vacature zodat wij je persoonlijke gegevens kunnen verwerken met jouw toestemming. Deze vacature staat open tot en met zondag 4 april 2021.
De eerste sollicitatiegesprekken willen wij uiterlijk in week 14 plannen.

Gelijke kansen
Wij zijn een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. Wij ontvangen graag sollicitaties van alle voldoende gekwalificeerde personen ongeacht hun ras, geslacht, functiebeperking, religie / levensovertuiging, seksuele geaardheid of leeftijd.

Wij geloven dat een diverse en inclusieve werkomgeving ons een relevantere, meer competitieve en veerkrachtiger organisatie maakt. Klik hier voor meer informatie over werken bij WUR met een functiebeperking.

Wij zijn

De missie van Wageningen University & Research is ‘To explore the potential of nature to improve the quality of life’. Binnen Wageningen University & Research bundelen Wageningen University en gespecialiseerde onderzoeksinstituten van Stichting Wageningen Research hun krachten om bij te dragen aan de oplossing van belangrijke vragen in het domein van gezonde voeding en leefomgeving.

Met ongeveer 30 vestigingen, 6.500 medewerkers en 12.500 studenten behoort Wageningen University & Research wereldwijd tot de aansprekende kennisinstellingen binnen haar domein. De integrale benadering van de vraagstukken en de samenwerking tussen verschillende disciplines vormen het hart van de unieke Wageningen aanpak. Wij zijn uitgeroepen tot Beste Werkgever in de categorie Onderwijs 2019-2020.

Kijk voor meer informatie over werken bij Wageningen UR op http://www.wageningenur.nl/nl/Werken-bij.htm.

The Leaseweb Product Management Team is looking for an experienced and talented Product Manager Cloud Storage to join our Product Management team. Do you know the IT, cloud and hosting market like the back of your hand? Are you passionate about technology and keen to develop and implement your own vision? Are you looking to join a fast moving, innovative company within the cloud and hosting industry? Get in touch.
What is the role about?
The Product Manager Cloud Storage will be in charge of developing and executing the commercial product strategy for our Cloud Storage products. You will help us grow Leaseweb’s business through a combination of using your product expertise, insight into market competition, and top-notch communication skills. You will develop a deep knowledge of our current offerings, map out the market, and identify the gaps. In close collaboration with sales, marketing, product owners and scrum teams, you will ensure that the right features are developed, launched, and maintained over the course of their lifecycle.Part of your responsibility will be to build and grow partnerships with technology partners, vendors, as well as multiple internal technology and support teams in order to build the next generation of cloud hosting products. As well as manage the ongoing lifecycle of current offerings. You will also guide product positioning and messaging, and drive the strategic direction of product portfolios.
Key responsibilities: 
Responsible for the product category strategy and development executionMaintain and optimize the overall value stream of the product by defining the commercial terms (pricing strategy and commercials), enabling the sales channel and facilitating deals.Interact with both current and potential customers to develop a deep understanding of their needsTranslate technology into relevant value propositions for customers and partnersResponsible for a clear and competitive portfolio of servicesEnsuring that the right infrastructure (make, buy, or partner) for the delivery of products is in place and optimized during their life-cycleLeading the go-to-market for the various functional organizations (e.g. channels, sales, legal, marketing, customer care), needed to make the proposition successfullyDeliver the sales tooling and training to enable sales to be successfulAct as thought leader for customers through online and live engagement and to industry analysts, helping to position Leaseweb globally
Who are you?
Our ideal candidate will have:
5+ years as a Product Manager or equivalentKnowledge of the Cloud, ISP or hosting industry, with a demonstrable technical understanding of Cloud and Cloud Storage products is requiredWork experience in the IT and/or telecommunications marketStrong commercial drive (profitability, pricing, targets)Outstanding communication skills, excellent command of EnglishCapability to work well with sales as well as technical specialistsAnalytical mindsetThrives in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environmentBachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Marketing requiredStrong motivational skillsCollaborative by nature with an open and engaging style
Benefits include:  Participation in annual company bonus scheme, a company pension, and monthly Internet allowance 25 days of paid time off (and the option to buy or sell up to 5 more days) Free lunch and parking, the best coffee (if we say so ourselves), and fresh fruit provided daily (when in the office) Attractive relocation packages and an agency that takes care of the entire visa processAccess to the Leaseweb Academy, a personalized learning platform offering a variety of studies, courses, and trainings Free in-house Dutch courses Fun events year-round – from virtual pub quizzes to summer parties, company runs, quarterly hackathons and much more Monthly after work drinks (also virtual, for now!) A multicultural work environment (our colleagues in HQ alone are from over 40 countries!) in a company where you can truly make a difference  
Ready for the next step? If you’d like to apply, please do so online. To learn more about us, follow us on LinkedIn or Instagram to get an inside look at the life at Leaseweb. For questions, please reach out to Tabea Hensel, Talent Acquisition Specialist, at: t.hensel@global.leaseweb.com

Posted by

Introduction
Want to be a Game Changer, then join us on one of Europe’s largest digitalisation transformation projects with Red Carpet IT Services.
Organization
Our international client is undertaking a significant modernisation program of its existing IT systems and architecture and rapidly moving towards a cloud-based IT solution. This includes a significant redesign of their storage environment using the latest principles in storage delivery.
Additionally, the infrastructure to support the modern platform is being overhauled to align with the future vision and values of the organisation.
If you are driven, motivated and wish to share in our client’s journey to a smarter and more sustainable future, then now is your chance to grab your dream assignment. We have multiple roles available covering HPE, Hitachi, IBM storage Knowledge & Expertise.
Function
Are you searching for a new and exciting challenge and would like to be involved with new & future technologies and play an instrumental role in the success of this project and have the following skills?
The main service activities to be provided for within the storage scope of work entail, SAN and Backup infrastructure maintenance and support are classified as follows:
Hardware Maintenance and supportResource provisioning / decommissioningPatch management and updates and upgradesSupport and troubleshootingSecurity incidents support, patch, and upgrades & implementation.Performance monitoring and reportingApplications and / or projects supportMigrationsDisaster Recovery ManagementTest environment maintenanceEngineering tasksIncident resolution and Change Request and Service requests & implementation.Capacity management and resource usage monitoring
If you have 3 to 5 years’ experience in this area, then we would like to get in touch with you. If you possess the necessary technical skills or would require further information, then please contact us.
Your profile
Senior Site Reliability Engineers with a proven history of working in an enterprise environment stretching multiple sites across multiple countries.Technical certification, skills, and experience HPE storage systemsUnderstand performanceUnderstand and setup short distance and long-distance replication.Discuss best practicesExplain HPE 3PAR events and alerts and how to get notifications.Use CLI and GUI to troubleshoot the storage system.Perform rebalancingUse Adaptive Flash Cache to increase performance.Upgrade the hardware and software of storage systems.Employ tools that can be used to troubleshoot and respond to HPE 3PAR performance issues.Technical certification, skills, and experience Hitachi storage systemsUnderstand performanceUnderstand and set up short distance and long-distance replication.Discuss best practicesExplain Hitachi VSP events and alerts and how to get notifications.Use CLI and GUI to troubleshoot storage systems.Perform migration to other storage systems.Employ tools that can be used to troubleshoot and respond to Hitachi VSP performance issues.

Requirements
Technical certification, skills, and experience Brocade switchesUnderstand performanceUnderstand and set up fabrics for short distance and long distance.Discuss best practicesExplain switches events and alerts and how to get notifications.Use CLI and GUI to troubleshoot the SAN.Check load balancingUpgrade hardware and software of the SAN switchesEmploy tools that can be used to troubleshoot and respond to SAN performance issues (Brocade Network Advisor)Technical certification, skills and experience IBM Spectrum protectUnderstand TSM server architectureCreate node, domain, storage pool, schedules.Discuss best practicesUse CLI and Operational Centre to troubleshoot the backup system.Understand performanceTechnical certification, skills, and experience z/OS Mainframe StorageMandatory qualifications for delivering the services are at least 5 years proven experience on mainframe disk storage platform administration in general, with specific attention to:Local (PPRC) and remote (XRC) replication protocol software administration.Virtual Tape System (VTS) and Data Facility Removable Media Manager (DFRMM) administration.Data migrations move volume data via TDMF.Due to the criticality of these services, it is essential that you either already possess knowledge of, or are capable to learn and absorb very quickly, the high level of knowledge needed for system engineering support of the major application systems of the EPO on the mainframe, such as Patent Grant Services or Doc Area.
Other technologies / technical skills
Some knowledge about the following subjects is highly appreciated:VMware ESXLinuxWindows serverNetworking
Non-technical skillsExcellent analysis and debugging skills.Ability to function as an individual contributor and a member of a team.Working with stakeholders and other team members to deliver and operate distributed services on-premises and in the cloud.Review others work and share knowledge.Delivery attitude and way of working.
You shall perform the Activities in a DevOps delivery model and be expected to show flexibility in adapting to changing requirements. Often temporary allocations of resources will be required to different projects with the intent of supporting various implementation projects.
Requests to focus in various areas could change rapidly from one domain to the other.You must be at ease with application development, DevOps, and Agile delivery, as well as being expected to exhibit ownership of the service delivered – i.e., a pro-active “my delivery” thinking rather than a disengaged request/ticket-based/reactive attitude.
OfferLocation: 80% of the activities shall be performed Off-Site.Start Date; April 2021. Duration 1 year with the possibility of multiple extensions.Working Language is English.
We can assist with acquiring a work permit for those who are non-EU citizens.

Ben jij de back-up- en virtualisatiespecialist die met ons mee wil groeien van on-premises naar (public) cloud en DevOps? Ben jij trots op je analytische skills en sta je te springen om te leren over nieuwe IT technologieën binnen en buiten je vakgebied? Dan is deze baan als Infrastructuur Ontwikkelaar Storage & Virtualisatie echt wat voor jou!

Als Infrastructuur Ontwikkelaar Storage & Virtualisatie verbeter je het huidige infrastructuurplatform en werk je aan de toekomst van a.s.r. Daarbij schakel je veel met je directe collega’s en medewerkers van verschillende business lines. In deze functie krijg je met veel ontwikkelingen te maken. a.s.r. gaat van een dual datacenter infrastructuur richting (public) cloud-omgevingen. Tegelijkertijd wordt het automatiseren van ons on-premises platform (infra-as-code), het Agile werken in multidisciplinaire teams en het leveren van klantwaarde steeds belangrijker. Jouw resultaatgerichtheid, leergierigheid en kennis over Back-up en Virtualisatie (vooral vRA/vRO) komen dan ook goed van pas. Word jij onze nieuwe Infrastructuur Ontwikkelaar?

Dit ga je doen als Infrastructuur Ontwikkelaar

 je draagt bij aan het continu verbeteren van de dienstverlening je ontwikkelt en onderhoudt on-premises en op termijn ook public cloud services, waarbij je Configuration Management tools gebruikt om Desired State Configuraties te realiseren je creëert self-service diensten die het team aanbiedt aan onze afnemers je bent verantwoordelijk voor de continuïteit van de dienstverlening en draait mee in de stand-by diensten
Deze vacature is echt iets voor jou, want jij hebt

 minstens 5 jaar ervaring op het gebied van Back-up en Virtualisatie en bij voorkeur een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding goede kennis van vRO, vRA, IBM Spectrum Protect Suite en hardware-configuraties (multi-vendor) programmeer- en/of scripting skills kennis van CM-tooling voor het bouwen van infrastructure-as-code en monitoring tools en bent in staat deze optimaal in te zetten bij voorkeur kennis van ESX-virtualisatie en Storage of je bent bereid om je te ontwikkelen op het gebied van Storage (SAN)
Hier ga je werken als Infrastructuur Ontwikkelaar in Utrecht

Je gaat werken binnen de afdeling Technology Services, waarin gewerkt wordt op basis van Agile-principes. Binnen deze afdeling werk je in een van onze multidisciplinaire teams, waar een collegiale en goede sfeer heerst waarin hard wordt gewerkt, maar ook tijd is voor ontspanning. We vinden het belangrijk dat we over de benodigde vakmanschap beschikken, zodat we behulpzaam, doortastend en vooruitdenkend te werk gaan. Kom jij kennis maken met a.s.r.?

Wat bieden we je

 tijd- en plaatsonafhankelijk werken bruto € 3.700,- tot € 5.300,- op basis van 38 uur per week, een collectieve pensioenregeling en een vaste 13e maand een goed bereikbare werkplek in Utrecht in één van de duurzaamste kantoorpanden van Nederland doorgroeimogelijkheden en een ruim opleidingsbudget voor trainingen en opleidingen naar keuze lees meer over wat jij van ons kan verwachten
Wie zijn wij?

a.s.r. hoort tot de top 3 verzekeraars van Nederland. Wij staan genoteerd aan Euronext Amsterdam en zijn opgenomen in de AEX. Via onze merken a.s.r., De Amersfoortse, Ditzo, Europeesche Verzekeringen, Ardanta en Loyalis bieden we producten en diensten aan op het gebied van verzekeren, pensioenen en hypotheken voor consumenten en MKB. Daarnaast zijn we actief als vermogensbeheerder en belegger via a.s.r. real estate en a.s.r. vermogensbeheer. Duurzaam ondernemen is voor ons vanzelfsprekend: als verzekeraar, belegger, werkgever én betrokken deelnemer aan de samenleving zoeken we steeds naar een goede balans tussen mens, maatschappij en milieu. Bij a.s.r. werken ruim 4000 medewerkers.

Solliciteer op deze ICT vacature

Enthousiast geworden? Reageer via de button ‘solliciteer'.

Neem bij vragen contact op met Juliet David via juliet.david@asr.nl of 06 22 608876.

Als je bij ons in dienst komt, vragen wij je om de eed of belofte af te leggen. Hiermee committeer je je aan onze gedragsregels. Medewerkers in de financiële sector zijn verplicht om een eed of belofte af te leggen.

Als onderdeel van onze sollicitatieprocedure vragen wij je een online assessment te doen. Alle informatie hierover ontvang je van Juliet.

Wij werken op een prettige manier samen met een aantal preferred suppliers. Acquisitie door werving- en selectie-, detachering- of uitzendbureaus wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.

As a Technical Support Engineer, you will provide technical support to customers, customer support personnel, and field support staff, focused on diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing and debugging NetApp products. About Gorillas

We are Gorillas and on a mission to redefine convenience retail. With our ten minute grocery deliveries we are disrupting the supermarket space, one of the biggest markets still in the hands of traditional players. We are a rapidly growing startup and are currently building an outstanding team with skilled members across all domains and backgrounds. We focus on building a diverse and inclusive company culture and aim to become a global leader in on-demand retail. Come join us on this journey.

We are looking for an Inventory Associate that will be a part of the team in our upcoming Micro Fulfillment Center, ensuring all inventory is accurate and organized. As an Inventory Associate you are an extremely important part of the company - you are the one making sure that our products are accurate and fresh!

Your Responsibilities Will Include
 Responsibility for physically managing the inventory inside the warehouse Closely coordinate with the Inventory Controller over product availability, quality and inventory accuracy Receive products from our suppliers and ensure the quality and physical count matches the purchase Store products to their inventory locations while making sure of the inventory accuracy Responsibility for updating inventories in the system and checking this on a regular basis Perform quality checks to ensure the ultimate freshness and best quality of all products for the customers Perform the physical listing and delisting's and rezoning's of products Actively be managing the back storage to ensure a high level of ready to pick (shelving of products and refill of beverages) Responsibility for managing the waste in the warehouse

Requirements
 Previous experience in a professional role in a similar environment (FMCG/Retail is a big plus) Familiar with the grocery retail space Strong hands-on mentality Very detailed oriented Love working with people and retail products at the same time Very good communication skills and a good proficiency in both written and spoken English

Benefits

What we offer
 A steep learning curve from day one Great opportunity to build something you are proud of An awesome team spirit and an exciting workplace with a dynamic and international environment A transparent company culture with flat hierarchies & a potential long-term engagement
Disclaimer

Gorillas is an equal opportunity employer, which means we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

What You Become a Part Of

You will become part of the Coca-Cola European Partners team of over 400 people working in Logistics in Great Britain.

Across Great Britain, CCEP has storage space for over 200,000 pallets of finished goods. Each pallet is around 2,500 cans of Coke (or the equivalent volume, for any our 600+ different formats and flavours). There are five CCEP factories where our products are made, each with its own warehouse. About half of our storage capacity is at the factory warehouses. There are also five third-party logistics (3PL) warehouses, which other companies such as Eddie Stobart run for us, at separate locations. The 3PL warehouses provide the other half of our storage capacity in Great Britain.

You will work with your line manager, the Senior Manager of 3PL Warehousing, to ensure the safe, efficient and cost-effective management of the five 3PL warehouses, located across the UK, where CCEP’s products are received, stored, repacked and despatched to meet the exacting demands of our customers in retail, wholesale and foodservice.

What To Expect

What will you study?

About

There is more information about the course content on the Aston University website, but an overview is shown here

You will study at Aston University for a BSc (Hons) degree in Supply Chain Management (Professional Practice). This course is based on the Supply Chain Leadership Professional Degree Apprenticeship Standard (Level 6). You will typically spend about two days per month at University.

Year 1 (2021)
Workplace SkillsWarehousing & Transport OperationsLogistics ManagementFinancial Management
Year 2 (2022)
Supply Chain AnalyticsPurchasing Principles for Global Supply ChainDeveloping Management Capability
Year 3 (2023)
Developing Leadership CapabilityManaging Projects & PerformanceTechnology & InnovationStrategic SC Management
Year 4 (2024)
Project WorkEnd Point Assessment

You will maintain a logbook throughout your apprenticeship, recording the projects you have completed and the knowledge, skills and behaviours you have learned.

What will you learn, from working in the Logistics team at CCEP?
Customer Focus: who CCEP’s customers are, in retail, wholesale, foodservice and other areas; how 3PL warehouse operations affect the service levels we provide to those customers and influence their perception of CCEP as a supplier.Financial Management: what it costs to operate a 3PL warehouse; how CCEP budgets and pays 3PLs for those costs; the practical difference between ‘low cost’ and ‘value for money’; and the financial trade-offs considered in decision-making.Compliance: the laws, rules, contracts and standards that apply in CCEP’s commercial relationships with logistics suppliers, for example on safety, quality, stock control, labour management and operational performance.Teamwork & Relationships: the business objectives of different parts of the supply chain, within and outside CCEP; why those objectives are not always perfectly aligned; how to communicate effectively and build collaborative relationships across teams.
Your Line Manager will set specific annual objectives for you to achieve, coaching and managing you to support your professional development. As well as your line manager, CCEP will assign you a Learning Mentor to help you navigate any conflicts between your work at CCEP and your work at Aston University and ensure you get the best out of the apprenticeship opportunity overall, including the on the job learning and academic study elements. Your Line Manager and Learning Mentor will both aim to ensure you become increasingly valuable to the team at CCEP, achieve your objectives, develop yourself and enjoy your job!

What We Expect Of You
No prior experience of logistics is necessary.You must demonstrate a clear commitment to your own learning, as you will have to show sufficient dedication to complete your university degree whilst also working full time.You must be fluent in English and be able to communicate effectively in both speaking and writing. Communication includes listening and it’s important to be a good listener.You must be sufficiently numerate to understand financial and operational numbers and graphs. You will have to use numeric data confidently in your communications with others.You must have some experience of working with other people. Teamworking will be a key part of the role and you will have to work towards business goals with people from within and outside CCEP.You must meet Aston University’s entry requirements: a minimum of 3 x Cs at A-level (or BTEC equivalent).You must be eligible for apprenticeship funding, as defined by the UK government.A Driving Licence is preferred, as frequent travel in England is essential.

What We Offer
Salary of € 10.25 per hourtravel allowance of a max. of € 9.50 per dayworking week from Mon to Fri from 9:00 till 18:00.Multiple growth opportunities within Yusenwho are you
You have some experience in logisticsYou are available for at least 3 business days, including Monday and FridayYou live at a maximum of 30 kilometers from Schiphol-RijkYou are physically fit because you are walking a lotwhat will you do

As a warehouse employee, you and your team are responsible for correct picking, careful packing and preparation of the orders. A job that requires a lot of responsibility and focus, since nobody wants to receive a scooter part for their motorcycle! where will you work

As a warehouse employee at Yusen you will work in the warehouse of one of the largest motorcycle companies in the world: Yamaha. This distribution center deals with the purchase, storage and sale of parts and accessories from Yamaha Motor Europe. From engine parts to Yamaha merchandise, it is all waiting in this warehouse for shipment around the world. You work with beautiful and cool products for motorcycles, snowmobiles and outboard motors, among other things.

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can make it easier for everyone to experience the world. Join us in our beautiful Amsterdam headquarters and work on planet Earth’s #1 accommodation marketplace with the industry’s smartest people!

About The Role

We are looking for an enthusiastic Full Stack Software Developer to join us in the App Marketing team in our Amsterdam HQ. In this position you will contribute to our mission to become a #1 travel app in the world. We do that by acquiring new customers, creating high quality landing pages and making it easier for customers to get started with the Booking.com app by providing a smooth onboarding experience and building deep-linking services.

We are a diverse group of people, with lots of passion for quality and doing the right thing. Come join us. You are guaranteed a fun, exciting time.

B.Responsible

You Will Be Responsible For

As a Full Stack Developer, you are responsible for developing world-class, complete web applications, both on the backend and frontend, for monitoring and addressing performance and security, and for developing customer-focused and scalable user experiences. You will work side-by-side with designers, product owners, copywriters and other developers to create new features, test your own ideas, and push changes live for billions of users.
 Development and delivery of distributed systems and services per business needs Continuous improvement of services by identifying flaws and potential issues, transforming monolith parts into services Development of new business ideas or optimisations of products and prioritisation for the highest business impact Collaborating with adjacent teams and other stakeholders to deliver on business objectives Contribute to Booking.com's growth through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts.
B.Skilled

Understanding the full stack of web development is vitally important in this role. We need self-starters who are great at solving problems, who initiate discussions, are solutions-oriented, customer focused and believe that any challenge can be scaled with the right mindset and tools.

We Are Looking For
 A minimum of 3 years of experience in web development. Strong working knowledge and experience with one or more server-side programming languages Experience building interactive front-end web UIs with HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Deep knowledge of JavaScript, including ES6; familiarity with modern web development frameworks, like React. Experience with relational data storage and SQL. Having experience with Kafka, Maven, Docker, and Kubernetes is a plus. Experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc. Experience working on products that impact a large user base or in an entrepreneurial startup environment. Passionate learners who aren’t afraid of new tools and technologies to build a great end-to-end customer experience.
B.Offered
 Contributing to a high scale, complex, world-renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work. Working in a fast-paced and performance-driven culture, career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. Training, hackathons and opportunities to travel and attend global conferences. Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits. Company sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture. Headquarters located in one of the most vibrant cities in Europe: Amsterdam. Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world.
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

Job Description:
What You Become a Part Of

You will become part of the Coca-Cola European Partners team of over 400 people working in Logistics in Great Britain.

Across Great Britain, CCEP has storage space for over 200,000 pallets of finished goods. Each pallet is around 2,500 cans of Coke (or the equivalent volume, for any our 600+ different formats and flavours). There are five CCEP factories where our products are made, each with its own warehouse. About half of our storage capacity is at the factory warehouses. There are also five third-party logistics (3PL) warehouses, which other companies such as Eddie Stobart run for us, at separate locations. The 3PL warehouses provide the other half of our storage capacity in Great Britain.

You will work with your line manager, the Senior Manager of 3PL Warehousing, to ensure the safe, efficient and cost-effective management of the five 3PL warehouses, located across the UK, where CCEP’s products are received, stored, repacked and despatched to meet the exacting demands of our customers in retail, wholesale and foodservice.

What To Expect

What will you study?

About

There is more information about the course content on the Aston University website, but an overview is shown here

You will study at Aston University for a BSc (Hons) degree in Supply Chain Management (Professional Practice). This course is based on the Supply Chain Leadership Professional Degree Apprenticeship Standard (Level 6). You will typically spend about two days per month at University.

Year 1 (2021)
Workplace SkillsWarehousing & Transport OperationsLogistics ManagementFinancial Management
Year 2 (2022)
Supply Chain AnalyticsPurchasing Principles for Global Supply ChainDeveloping Management Capability
Year 3 (2023)
Developing Leadership CapabilityManaging Projects & PerformanceTechnology & InnovationStrategic SC Management
Year 4 (2024)
Project WorkEnd Point Assessment

You will maintain a logbook throughout your apprenticeship, recording the projects you have completed and the knowledge, skills and behaviours you have learned.

What will you learn, from working in the Logistics team at CCEP?
Customer Focus: who CCEP’s customers are, in retail, wholesale, foodservice and other areas; how 3PL warehouse operations affect the service levels we provide to those customers and influence their perception of CCEP as a supplier.Financial Management: what it costs to operate a 3PL warehouse; how CCEP budgets and pays 3PLs for those costs; the practical difference between ‘low cost’ and ‘value for money’; and the financial trade-offs considered in decision-making.Compliance: the laws, rules, contracts and standards that apply in CCEP’s commercial relationships with logistics suppliers, for example on safety, quality, stock control, labour management and operational performance.Teamwork & Relationships: the business objectives of different parts of the supply chain, within and outside CCEP; why those objectives are not always perfectly aligned; how to communicate effectively and build collaborative relationships across teams.
Your Line Manager will set specific annual objectives for you to achieve, coaching and managing you to support your professional development. As well as your line manager, CCEP will assign you a Learning Mentor to help you navigate any conflicts between your work at CCEP and your work at Aston University and ensure you get the best out of the apprenticeship opportunity overall, including the on the job learning and academic study elements. Your Line Manager and Learning Mentor will both aim to ensure you become increasingly valuable to the team at CCEP, achieve your objectives, develop yourself and enjoy your job!

What We Expect Of You
No prior experience of logistics is necessary.You must demonstrate a clear commitment to your own learning, as you will have to show sufficient dedication to complete your university degree whilst also working full time.You must be fluent in English and be able to communicate effectively in both speaking and writing. Communication includes listening and it’s important to be a good listener.You must be sufficiently numerate to understand financial and operational numbers and graphs. You will have to use numeric data confidently in your communications with others.You must have some experience of working with other people. Teamworking will be a key part of the role and you will have to work towards business goals with people from within and outside CCEP.You must meet Aston University’s entry requirements: a minimum of 3 x Cs at A-level (or BTEC equivalent).You must be eligible for apprenticeship funding, as defined by the UK government.A Driving Licence is preferred, as frequent travel in England is essential.

Summary

Key Requirements:

 What is StreetSide?

StreetSide is a grocery delivery and curbside pickup service offered at select United Family locations. StreetSide makes it easy for guests to place orders 24-hours a day, and pick up curbside at a time convenient for them, or have it delivered directly to their homes. Orders are carefully selected and bagged by Personal Shoppers, guaranteeing the freshest product, longest available shelf lives, careful handling and the same ultimate service the United Family is known for.

StreetSide Personal Shoppers are first and foremost responsible for guest relations and satisfaction by building a reputation for Ultimate Service. He/She is responsible for selecting StreetSide online orders and packaging them in accordance with Store Operations Policies. He/She is responsible for ensuring that all perishable and non-perishable merchandising areas in relation to StreetSide are clean and free of debris.
 When a guest enters my area or department, my first and most important responsibility becomes to acknowledge, greet, and engage that guest  Accurately select the highest quality product offering for our StreetSide guests to meet and exceed company expectations of providing Ultimate Service  Package, transport, and load groceries and merchandise from the store to the guestsâ€™ vehicle  Assist in selecting, sorting, unloading merchandise from baskets or totes into refrigeration, frozen, or dry storage area, and returning products to their proper location  Gather baskets and pick up trash inside and outside the StreetSide area as needed  Maintain and stock bag areas  Provide Ultimate Service by answering product-related questions, locating products, and helping guests as needed.  Organize, clean, and prepare prep area, backroom, and sales floor for incoming trucks  Load, unload, and move heavy, bulky products to support StreetSide order selection  Maintain standards for safety and sanitation  Minimize shrink through careful handling of product  Achieve productivity standards as set forth by the company  Comply with all Federal, State, and Company regulations and standards for product freshness, food safety, and sanitation  Utilize digital handheld to select items necessary to complete order from store, to pack and put away guest orders in staging area, and to retrieve orders for guests  Other duties as required or assigned by supervisor

Key Responsibilities
 Must be 18 years of age or older  High school diploma or equivalent  Excellent guest service and communication skills  Ability to prioritize and handle cross functional tasks  Must be able to lift up to 50lbs and stand for long periods of time (up to 6 hours)  Perform all other physical aspects of the job including but not limited to: bending, squatting, lifting, climbing, and walking  Ability to function as a team member and get along with others  Ability to accept supervisory coaching related to performance, work habits and attitude

Job Description:
Description

Relational Database Service (RDS) is one of the fastest growing AWS businesses, providing and managing relational databases as a service. RDS is seeking talented database engineers who will innovate and engineer solutions in the area of database technology.

We need individuals who are enthusiastic about applying bold new ideas to solving real-world customer problems and who are passionate about working with customers. Candidates must be able to translate customers' needs and use cases into technical innovation and robust engineering solutions on AWS.

The Database Engineering team is actively engaged in the ongoing database engineering process, partnering with development groups and providing deep subject matter expertise to feature design, and as an advocate for bringing forward and resolving customer issues. In this role you act as the “Voice of the Customer” helping software engineers understand how customers use databases.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Basic Qualifications
 Deep knowledge and experience designing and maintaining PostgreSQL relational databases Experience migrating databases from commercial engines to Aurora PostgreSQL Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (EC2, EBS, S3, etc.) Systems engineering experience, including Linux performance, memory management, I/O tuning, configuration, security, networking, clusters and troubleshooting. Storage engineering experience, including NAS, SAN, SSD, multi-pathing and caching. Experience building and maintaining complex mission-critical production database systems Broad awareness of customer workloads and use cases, including performance, availability and scalability Experience analyzing issues holistically, from the application tier through the database, down to the storage. Experience working directly with customers, resolving database, systems and infrastructure-related issues and also providing systems architecture leadership. Awareness of emerging technologies and approaches in IT Working knowledge of relational database internals (locking, consistency, serialization, recovery paths) Working knowledge of at least one scripting language (shell, Python, Perl). Working knowledge of at least one application programming language (Java, C#, C, C++, Go) Coding skills in the procedural language for at least one database engine a must (PL/SQL, T-SQL etc.) Excellent communication skills. Experience engineering, administering and managing multiple relational database flavors (e.g. Oracle, MySQL, SQLServer, PostgreSQL)
Preferred Qualifications
 Experience migrating application code from commercial database engines to Aurora PostgreSQL Consulting experience is a plus
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit US Disability Accommodations.
