Company Description

Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 50,000 staff across a network of more than 900 independent companies in over 50 countries and operating more than 800 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialised clinical diagnostics testing. In 2019, Eurofins generated total revenues of EUR € 4.56 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.

Job Description

As Systems Engineer, you will primarily be responsible for the engineering, configuration, installation, maintenance, and upgrade of physical and virtual servers, storage, backups, and disaster recovery planning.

OVERALL OBJECTIVES

Management Services, Server, Storage, Backup
Research, evaluate, and recommend hardware and software for servers, storage (SAN/NAS), and backup solutions;Configure, operate, and upgrade on-premises and cloud infrastructure;Manage Compute and Storage resources, on-premises or in Azure Cloud;Implement infrastructure disaster recovery plans;Perform daily system checks, verifying the integrity and availability of all involved infrastructure resources and key processes; Assist with advanced troubleshooting (proficient in all levels and phases of systems support), backup, and archiving;Identify, diagnose, and resolve connection, reliability, or performance issues;Contact vendor technical support for Priority 1 incidents and requests;Develop scripts to automate repetitive administration tasks;Participate in an after-hours on-call support rotation and implement solutions (upgrades, new releases, …), patching and deployment activities after hours as needed;Validate system upgrades and patches when required.

Core IT Infrastructure Technology / Operations Duties
Partner with other infrastructure Team Members to learn, develop and enhance the skills needed to support software-based infrastructure;Ensure that IT Services are delivered effectively to business customers. This includes the execution of SOPs, management of IT Incidents/Problems and IT Changes as per well-defined ITIL processes, as implemented in the ITSM system (ServiceNow);Deliver quality documentation allowing smooth day-to-day operations;Perform system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all involved infrastructure resources; Ensure that performance, scalability, and security is maintained and optimized;Identify opportunities to innovate, extend and enhance service delivery wherever possible;Participate in disaster recovery plan and practicing recovery operations;Consult with senior peers to learn through experience;Partner with key vendors to maintain an understanding of new technology and leading practices;Cooperate closely with other Zone / Regional / Group IT Infra resources. Qualifications

Education
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT or similar

Additional / Certifications
Certification in VMware, NetApp, Microsoft Azure or similar technologies is a plus;Agile or ITIL Foundation certification is a plus.

Work Experience
Minimum of 3-7 years of experience in supporting Server environments, preferably Windows 2012 or 2016 Server, in managing VMware virtual server environments, and in managing (incl. designing, configuring, upgrading, etc.) storage solutions and backup solutions;Minimum of 1-3 years of experience in managing public cloud-based (MS Azure preferred) (Server & Storage) resources (in multiple availability regions); Solid prior experience with Dell, Lenovo and NetApp technologies;Experience with all or some of the most important hardware vendors like IBM, Dell, Lenovo, Nutanix or HP;Experience with NetApp storage technologies or alternatives like EMC, EqualLogic, or Nimble;Experience with backup tools like Commvault or Veeam.

Competencies & Skills

Technical
Experience in IT Infrastructure and Operations administration, engineering, architecture (enterprise scale), including demonstrated working experience with:
Microsoft Windows server 2012 R2 and newer;Virtualization technologies, Hyper-V or VMware is preferable;Automation and self-service solutions.Scripting languages (PowerShell is preferable);Good knowledge of Azure fundamentals (IAM, network, security, etc.), as well as working experience with the (provisioning of / migration to / support of) Azure Server & Storage resources;Hands-on experience in creating a resource group, virtual networks, load balancer, virtual machine, attaching storage disks, amongst other operations in cloud, etc.;Experience supporting IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS based solutions;Experience with Server / Storage backup & disaster recovery preparedness, monitoring, testing, and response;A solid understanding of the Linux and Windows operating system, virtual machines and networking fundamentals;Experience monitoring production systems, root cause analysis, and troubleshooting;Experience with the Agile methodology and its concepts;A good understanding of ITIL-based processes.

Other / Soft Skills
Passion for technology and staying current with emerging security trends;Used to working in a fast-paced environment with a career track record of engineering, developing, deploying, and maintaining business critical systems;Able to troubleshoot complex problems, and translate technical issues into understandable business language for end users;Able to prioritize, drive results and provide clear and documented status updates/metrics to management;Able to translate business requirements into scalable infrastructure designs, cost models and forecasts;Compliance with standards for quality, performance or productivity;Knowledge of laboratory (or similar regulated/controlled environment) operations and processes is a plus;Familiarity with relevant regulatory requirements (GxP, GDPR, …) is a plus;Fluent English language skills (written and spoken) is required.

Additional Information

APPLICATION

As the role and Eurofins' IT Talent Acquisition team are international, please ensure to send your application in English.

POSSIBLE LOCATIONS FOR THE ROLE
Barcelona, SpainGhent, Flanders, BelgiumLeiden, NetherlandsMilano, Italy

What You Do At AMD Changes Everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

 Logistics Specialist - European distribution

The Role

AMD International Sales & Service is looking for an experienced Logistics Professional with experience in freight forwarding/warehousing, with knowledge of Import and Export in the European Union. This person will strengthen the small AMD team located in the Netherlands (Hoofddorp). The Team is responsible for continuous improvement efforts in European Logistics, as part of the greater Global Logistics team.

The main responsibility is the distribution of finished goods in EMEA region and support of Sales and Marketing flows. The Dutch team actively leads outsourced Logistics Distribution points and partners in the Netherlands, Czech Republic and Germany—and assists with Customs, Warehousing and Transportation matters.

The team serves as liaison between internal AMD stakeholders, Customer warehouses and the partners who operationally manage storage and moving AMD product. In addition, the team has administrative responsibility for financial auditing, filing and reporting, in close contact with teams in European headquarter - located in Munich, Germany.

The Person

Do you have solid experience in distribution or warehousing, and a self-starter mentality with a drive for continuous improvement? If so, this is a great opportunity for you to work for a highly successful Fortune 500 technology company!

  Review Daily updates Data-logs NL + CZ. Inbound and Outbound freight tracking.   Review in-transit NL + CZ and active follow ups.   Customer service - address customer issues/questions.   Ensure download all digital invoices + PODs for audit purposes, chase refunds on shipments that did not meet requirements.
 Financial / Reporting data
  Review (Approve/Audit) exceptions and process weekly payment flow in our Freight Audit and Pay software tool for Netherlands and Czech.   Ensure re-charges are processed for several internal stakeholders.   Review and approve all European Logistics Invoicing.   Process some local manual invoices   Liaison between Account Payable and suppliers/vendors   Support VAT reporting Netherlands and Czech   Support Waste reporting Germany.   Support Intrastate reporting - First week Calendar Month (NL + CZ)   Prepare Monthly Accruals
 Logistics activity Europe Region – general info on responsibilities under NL team

  Warehouse   Distribution   Cross-dock   Returns   Sales and Marketing   Scrap

 Global Foundries (Dresden) / Schenker warehouse (Radeburg)
  End of Quarter wafer shipments (STUB)   Daily wafer shipments   Probe cards
 AMD GmbH (Munchen)
  Support Sales and Marketing flows European Region   Engineering Freight activities   Support Germany with import and export overall   Support Shipping & Receiving challenges physical Munich office

Preferred Experience

You must be fluent in spoken and written English. Fluency in Dutch is strongly preferred. Knowledge of German and Czech language is helpful.

Start in het Platform Engineering Young Professional bij Quintor!Ons Platform Engineering Young Professional Programma is de vliegende start die jouw carrière nodig heeft. Ben jij net klaar met je opleiding in de richting van Security, Netwerk- en Systeembeheer of IT Infastructure? Met dit uitdagende twee jarige programma loop jij twee stappen voor en maak je binnen no-time de stap naar Senior Platform Engineer met gedegen ervaring op gebieden als Docker en Kubernetes maar ook Cloud Security. Start met een zorgvuldig samengestelde 11 weken durende masterclass en werk gedurende twee jaar aan baanbrekende projecten, onder begeleiding van ervaren Quintor professionals. Ben jij klaar voor de volgende stap?
Hoe werkt het?Je begint met de 11 weken durende masterclass, waarin we je opleiden tot Platform Engineering expert in een enterprise omgeving. De masterclass bestaat uit een combinatie van theoretische kennis afgewisseld met praktijk opdrachten onder begeleiding van ervaren Platform Engineers.Hierna ga je aan de slag bij je eerste project. Wij gaan aan de hand van jouw competenties kijken wat voor klus goed bij je past en waar je je optimaal kunt door ontwikkelen. Dit project kan bij een klant zijn, maar ook in-house. Je werkt met ervaren collega’s van Quintor, om je zo optimaal mogelijk te begeleiden. Naast je project volg je bij Quintor regelmatig trainingen en hands-on sessies, om je kennis uit te breiden. Op deze manier ben jij straks na twee jaar al een senior.
Voor wie is het?Je hebt een relevante HBO of WO opleiding afgerond. Tijdens je opleiding heb je onder andere kennis opgedaan van IT Security, Netwerk- en Systeembeheer, het migreren en van platforms, het opzetten van virtuele omgevingen. Ons trainingsprogramma is intensief, dus je hebt affiniteit met infrastructuur, zodat je het succesvol af kan ronden. Je hebt een passie voor technologie en je bent gedreven in je werk. Ook lijkt het je wat om in scrum teams te werken.
Wat ga ik leren?Om je optimaal voor te bereiden op je eerste project volg je eerst onze masterclass. Je wordt opgeleid tot expert in de wereld van ops, devops, en PAAS oplossingen. Aan de hand van een realistische praktijkcase duiken we in technieken op het gebied van hypervisors, storage, networking, intrusion detection en prevention, automated provisioning, container plaforms inclusief Docker clustering, en application servers, databases en voip en mail oplossingen. Ook code kwaliteit en ontwikkelstraten komen aan bod, zodat je als platform engineer in staat bent om de brug te zijn naar diverse ontwikkel afdelingen. Je beëindigt het young professional programma met een aantal certificeringen op het gebied van Linux, windows en wordt gecertificeerd in het kanban proces.
Wat is het programma van de Masterclass?Introductie Quintor (QFC)Module InfrastructureModule Operating SystemModule PKIModule Netwerk ArchitectuurModule ProvisioningModule ProxiesModule Logging and MonitoringModule Windows ServerModule DockerModule Continuous IntegrationModule KubernetesModule JavaAfsluitende Praktijkcase
Wat ga ik doen?Je levert een belangrijke bijdrage aan de ontwikkeling van de infrastructuur en maatwerk platformen voor onze klanten bij jou in de regioJe werkt in scrumteams volgens de Agile methode.Je maakt gebruik van geautomatiseerd testen van infra-as-code oplossingen en zaken als Docker en KubernetesJe blijft vooroplopen in platform engineering door het volgen van workshops en trainingen.Onze stack? SaltStack, Docker, Kubernetes, Bamboo, Prometheus, Elastic, Mysql, Ansible, Bash, Chatbots, SSL, Apache Tomcat, Nginx, SonarQube, Git, Voip, DSC, Vagrant, Proxmox, Backup, PKI, Iptables, Yum, chocolaty, Active Directory, PosgtresQL
Wat bieden wij jou?Direct een arbeidsovereenkomst met een uitstekend salaris en prima arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder een laptop, leaseauto en een goede pensioenregeling.De mogelijkheid om je in twee jaar te ontwikkelen tot senior platform engineer.Uitdagende projecten bij jou in de buurt.Een team van jonge, hoogopgeleide, enthousiaste en ambitieuze collega’s.Mogelijkheden voor het bezoeken van seminars en events zoals J-Fall, Devoxx en ons eigen Summercamp.
Hoe verloopt mijn sollicitatie?Eerst kom je op gesprek bij een van onze recruiters. Dit is een kennismakingsgesprek om te kijken of wij bij elkaar passen. Wanneer er een goede match is doe je een coding test. Na deze test volgt een gesprek waarin we dieper ingaan op jouw programmeer ervaring. Tijdens dit gesprek krijg je meteen een aanbod voor een arbeidsovereenkomst!

Job Description

Job Title: Backend Engineer

Location: Amsterdam, The Netherlands

About This Role

As a backend engineer, you'll be responsible for working on a large data pipeline. This data pipeline collects over 50 billion records per day and is built using a variety of languages and tools.
In the role, you will work directly on code that handles the receiving and processing of data as well as working closely with DevOps to build out and maintain infrastructure in AWS.
In this role you will get the opportunity to work with cutting edge data processing tools and the latest AWS services as well.

What You’ll Do
 Enhance data processing pipelines that handles 100+ trillion requests per month  Create monitoring and automation workflows including a full Continuous Integration and Deployment.  Continue to research new technologies to improve data processing end to end.

What You’ll Need
 3-5 years of experience coding and working with large data sets  Understand the inner workings of the technologies involved in web applications (including but not limited to security, cookies, local storage, and web services)  Solid understanding of Computer Science fundamentals, software engineering principles, and technologies  A very good command of the English language.  You enjoy working as a member of a team and consider feedback a learning opportunity  Open to learning new languages, platforms, and technologies

What Would Be A Great To Have
 Strong understanding of JavaScript (preferably backend, i.e. NodeJS)
 Experience with Python, AWS and / or C++

Benefits
 Keep learning: The possibility to surround yourself with exceptionally talented individuals, widely regarded as leaders in the digital space. Collaborate with talented people, get trained and challenge yourself every day. There's an endless array of events, classes; and development opportunities to help all employees achieve goals.  Be creative: You don’t have to follow the norm to be successful – we encourage you to think outside the box. Our culture is built on encouraging innovative ideas, communication and joint success.  Informal Work Atmosphere: We believe in getting the job done in a comfortable, casual environment!  The ability to become a truly global engineer, with exposure to markets across the world. With more than 30 offices around the world, many Comscore teams work together across locations.  Possibility to attend conferences, seminars and other industry events  Dutch collective Pension Plan, with a possibility to include your family  Possibility to participate in collective health insurance plan, for you and your family  Full compensation for your commute to work by public transportation  A flexible Company fitness plan with plenty of options to choose from  25 vacation days  Competitive salary & benefits

About Comscore

At Comscore, we’re pioneering the future of cross-platform media measurement, arming organizations with the insights they need to make decisions with confidence. Central to this aim are our people who work together to simplify the complex on behalf of our clients & partners. Though our roles and skills are varied, we’re united by our commitment to five underlying values: Integrity, Velocity, Accountability, Teamwork, and Servant Leadership. If you’re motivated by big challenges and interested in helping some of the largest and most important media properties and brands navigate the future of media, we’d love to hear from you.

Comscore (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a trusted partner for planning, transacting and evaluating media across platforms. With a data footprint that combines digital, linear TV, over-the-top and theatrical viewership intelligence with advanced audience insights, comScore allows media buyers and sellers to quantify their multiscreen behavior and make business decisions with confidence. A proven leader in measuring digital and set-top box audiences and advertising at scale, Comscore is the industry’s emerging, third-party source for reliable and comprehensive cross-platform measurement. To learn more about Comscore, please visit comscore.com.

Merkle is een toonaangevend Customer Experience Management (CXM) bureau, waarbij data en technologie de drijvende krachten zijn. Merkle heeft ruim 50 vestigingen en 9600 medewerkers over de gehele wereld en is onderdeel van dentsu. In Amsterdam en Rotterdam werken meer dan 285 mensen voor toonaangevende klanten zoals Microsoft, HEMA, NS, Marktplaats, Vodafone, BMW, Air France-KLM, Signify, Burger King en Corendon. Het bedrijf is strategisch partner van o.a. Google, Adobe, Salesforce, Bol.com en Selligent.
Dit ga je doen…Als Data Engineer maak je deel uit van het data & analytics team binnen Merkle. Dit team houdt zich bezig met het inzetten van technische oplossingen voor onze klanten. Op basis van deze inzichten adviseert het team de interne en externe opdrachtgevers zodat zij hun marketingactiviteiten verder kunnen optimaliseren en verdere groei kunnen realiseren. In de rol van Data Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor zowel het ontwerpen van de architectuur als het ontwikkelen van ETL en streaming oplossingen op het gebied van marketing & customer data.
Bij Merkle werken we met veel verschillende customer en marketing gerelateerde systemen. Denk aan:Marketing automation / e-mail tools: Selligent, Adobe, Salesforce, Clang;Customer Data Platforms (CDPs): Tealium, Relay42, Blueconic, Adobe, Exponea, Segment;Analytics platforms: Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Snowplow;Advertising platforms: Google Marketing Platform, Microsoft, Facebook, Affiliate, Display netwerken (AdForm / Xandr) & online marketplaces (Bol.com / Amazon);PIM / Product / Inventory feeds;CRM systemen: Salesforce;Business Intelligence tools (Tableau, Looker, Google Data Studio).
Het wordt jouw uitdaging om al deze systemen naadloos met elkaar samen te laten werken. Met collega data analisten en data scientists ga je inzichten uit deze systemen combineren en werk je cases uit om deze data te activeren in marketing kanalen of andere systemen.
Wat wij vragen...De ideale kandidaat wordt zichtbaar gedreven door het vak, is zeer bevlogen en leergierig. Ook beschik je over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, ben je proactief en oplossingsgericht. Jouw kennis en vaardigheden vullen ons team aan en klanten ervaren jou als technisch expert met oog voor data. Je bent nieuwsgierig naar nieuwe terreinen aangezien we vaak samen met onze klanten nieuwe en unieke oplossingen bedenken en bouwen. Je weet collega’s en klanten mee te nemen in oplossingen en proposities van het analytics team. Daarnaast ben je op zoek naar een creatieve werkomgeving waar je je talenten kunt inzetten, je verder kunt ontwikkelen en dagelijks het verschil kunt maken. Wij hebben het allemaal.  
In de meeste gevallen gebruiken onze klanten het Google Cloud Platform als het gaat om marketing data. Veel gebruikte services zijn: Google BigQuery, Cloud Functions, Pub/Sub Cloud Composer, Storage & Dataflow.
Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Hadoop/spark en streaming technieken (bijv. Kafka) zijn een duidelijke pre,.Gewenste talen:PythonJavascript / Node.jsSQL
Tools & Frameworks:Apache AirflowDockerREST / GraphQLGit / GitLabETLStreaming / real-time architecture
Ervaring met de technische kant van eerder genoemde marketing & customer systemen (bijv. Google Analytics en Facebook) is een sterke pre.
Wat kenmerkt jou nog meer…1-3 jaar ervaring met data engineering;Ervaring of affiniteit met digital analytics is een pre;Pragmatisch, zelfstandig, analytisch en sterke communicatieve vaardigheden!
Wat wij bieden...Best veel, maar hier wat highlights:Een medior rol met veel vraagstukken die je uitdagen om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen. Veel verantwoordelijkheid, ruimte voor ondernemerschap;Een uitdagende functie met veel aandacht voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling, door workshops en trainingen;Een uitdagende omgeving met diverse opdrachtgevers. Van groot tot klein. Zo raak je in relatief weinig tijd bekend met veel verschillende branches, tools en methodieken;Een goed salaris met prima secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden;Voldoende ruimte voor andere dingen naast je werk. Tafeltennis, (thema)borrels, feestjes, ‘op kamp’ met alle collega’s en meer;Je komt te werken in een enthousiast en groeiend team van verschillende data specialisten. Met zijn allen delen we kennis en sparren we over klantproblemen.Een internationale werkomgeving. Sparren met collega’s over de hele wereld!
Persoonlijke ontwikkeling op maat. Veel nadruk en ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.Een trainingsprogramma waarin je je ontwikkelt als persoon en consultant;Cursussen, trainingen en opdrachten om aan je eigen ontwikkeling te werken;Een senior consultant die je coacht en met je spart over jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling

De voordelen van containerisatie zijn eindeloos. Jij kent ze vast wel. En onze klanten inmiddels ook. Als enige partij in Nederland hebben wij ruim 15 implementaties van OpenShift verzorgd bij deze klanten. En weet je wat zo gaaf is? Het worden er steeds meer en meer! Containerisatie is een onderwerp wat veel bij klanten speelt. Als je bij HCS Company aan de slag gaat dan word je betrokken bij deze trajecten. Van idee tot implementatie van het Red Hat OpenShift platform. Of misschien ligt jouw kracht juist bij het beheren van het platform. Nieuwe versies komen uit en de mogelijkheden zijn eindeloos. Waar jouw ambitie ook ligt, het is mogelijk bij ons.
Welke uitdaging ga jij aan?Kubernetes fan? Ga jij nog voor Docker of heb je CRI-O al ontdekt?Monitoring inregelen met Prometheus en Grafana? Logging via ELK jou bekend?De laatste versie Red Hat OpenShift ken jij. Jij kunt ons vast de verschillen uitleggen met de vorige versies.Wat zijn volgens jou de 10 voordelen van een OpenShift containerplatform?En de 10 nadelen van Red Hat OpenShift? Of zijn die er niet? ;)Wil jij developers helpen bij het inrichten van pipelines?YAML kennis genoeg? Jenkins of Tekton? Waar ga jij voor? Generieke pipelines, specifieke pipelines of beide?Kun jij workloads verplaatsen van AWS naar Azure zonder verstoring van beschikbaarheid van je apps?Container Storage: Wil je de beste in worden in Ceph met OCS
Interesse? Kijk voor meer informatie op: www.hcs-company.com/vacatures/openshift-engineer

Job Title: Data Engineer for a new music streaming service
Job Description:
Havnegade 27
1058 København K

 Data Engineer for a new music streaming service needed!

Please Follow Us On Facebook

Please follow us on Instagram:

Please Follow Us On LinkedIn

Please follow us on Twitter -

 Data Engineer for a new music streaming service
 Help us shape the music streaming service of the future!
We are a forward-thinking music streaming company, driven to revolutionize the music streaming scene by putting our unique music recommendation AI in the hands of the user - making music discovery a more personal, relevant, and shared experience than we know it today.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our growing Data Management team at our headquarters in central Copenhagen. You will be working with cutting-edge technologies around data processing and data warehouse.

Understanding the data generated by our apps and users is essential to help us improve our services and the user experience. All parts of our organization depend on reliable and timely insight into data and we need your help to keep delivering and supporting the organization.

In the Data Management team, you will be working on maintaining and improving data pipelines, storage, transformation, and enrichment of data. You will keep a focus on security and GDPR rules. Help design, setup, and run an AWS hosted data lake using technologies such as Kafka and Apache Druid. In collaboration with other teams in engineering and marketing, you will work on a common taxonomy and work towards a common understanding of the data.

Responsibilities
  I  mplement, configure, monitor, and improve a strong foundation for collecting, processing, and surfacing our data   Define data platform architecture   Build data pipelines to transform, enrich, compress data   Integrate with 3rd party systems   Write, maintain, optimize, refactor, and own robust code   Thoroughly test and document code and fix issues   Understand the data needs from all parts of the organization   Work towards a common taxonomy for events from different platforms   Collaborate on maintaining, and optimizing the underlying infrastructure for the data pipelines and warehouse   Actively contribute to the decision making in the Data Management team

Desired Abilities And Skills
  Amazon AWS platform: experience with integrating applications and platforms with AWS (e.g., Kinesis, Glue, EC2, EMR, S3, Lambda, Step Functions)  Excellent Python skills   Experience with running/maintaining Apache Kafka   Experience with Apache Druid / Imply   Experience with Docker   Strong hands-on skills and excellent team player   Fluent in English   Experience with running/deploying data processing flows in a distributed manner using PySpark on AWS EMR   Infrastructure as Code: experience with provisioning Cloud services using CloudFormation, Terraform, AWS CDK, or similar

We Offer
  A position with room for growth   A diverse team of talented people with an interest in music   Work with cutting- edge technologies   Flexible working hours   Great office space in central Copenhagen with a view over the canals   Laptop of your choice   Free coffee and fruit

About Us

The Moodagent team is a close-knit bunch of music-loving software developers, design thinkers, musicologists, data scientists, and machine learning experts from many corners of the world. Within the Data Management team, you will be working in close cooperation with fellow developers. At times, our tasks get rather interdisciplinary, and we consider that to be a good thing.

We juggle with a lot of fun stuff: music, big data, microservices, cloud computing, AI & machine learning, massively scalable systems, apps, web - all as part of, and an ever-flowing stream of delightfully intricate challenges to make these things come together as a whole.

We have an informal tone, occasional fun on Fridays, and a shared passion for music.

 When
March 2021

Where

Moodagent HQ, Havnegade 27, 1058 København

The Recruitment Process

The recruitment process is easy!

Click the START button to the right, upload your CV and answer the detailed questions so we get to know more about you and your competencies. It usually takes just 10-15 minutes to apply for a job so this means that you do NOT have to produce a time-consuming written application. If you choose to upload a cover letter to support your application, please be brief and tell us WHY you are the best candidate for the position based on your experience.

So, if you're looking for a company that offers awesome tech, interdisciplinary work, world-class challenges and celebrates creative freedom to solve these, we can't wait to meet you! Apply now.

At Beerwulf we're looking for a Data Engineer to join our team.

HI SOON-TO-BE NEW DATA ENGINEER OF BEERWULF.com
We’re a pretty young company (4 years young), and we've recently evolved from start-up to scale-up phase. We are active in 11 European countries, and offer a dynamic and innovative work environment where you can truly make an impact. Our team is a selected blend of around 70 beer and eCommerce specialists.
We are now looking for a multi-disciplined and excellent problem solver Data Engineer with 4+ years of work-experience. As a Data Engineer you will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to ensure we have high-quality data to empower our business in all departments. Your challenge will be to make sure we can utilize our large-scale data even more effectively to support business decisions and improve our products. Joining a cross-functional team of data engineers, analysts and product owners, we invite you to help us devour the data to ensure our place as the #1 beer shop in Europe. Are you up for this challenge?

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL FOCUS ON
As a Data Engineer, you are responsible for the development, performance, quality, and scaling of our data pipelines, with a special focus on data quality. You will work independently and will also be responsible for making technical decisions within a team.
Your key responsibilities
Our Data Platform. You'll be joining to help us improving our data platform to support business even better on their daily data-driven decisions.End-to-end ownership of data quality in our core datasets and data pipelines.
Solving issues with data and data pipelines, prioritizing based on customer impact.Experimenting with new tools and technologies to meet business requirements regarding performance, scaling, and data quality.Last but not least, having an Ecommerce business mindset with an eagle eye for data opportunities in every department of the company.

THE THINGS YOU BRING TO BEERWULF AS A DATA ENGINEER
Minimum of 3 years experience as a Data Engineer with production-grade engineering expertise in Python and SQL. C# knowledge is a plus.Experience with building scalable data pipelines in distributed environments using Azure Data Stack like ADF, Azure Synapse, Datalake Storage, etc; and surrounding technologies such as Databricks, Spark/PySpark, Kafka, SQL Server, etc.
Knowledgeable about data modeling, data access, and data storage techniques.Good understanding of basic analytics and machine learning concepts.The ability to work on other cross-functional projects in which you are able to show your strong organizational and multitasking skills. You can communicate technical realities, possibilities and limitations very clearly to colleagues from every background.Preferably a university degree in Computer Science.Fluency in English and a master in the art of coding. Please note you must be eligible to work in the EU!

But above all, you have a healthy amount of beer-love and are excited to work for the online beer retailer that is conquering Europe!

MEET THE TEAM

NEXT STEPS FOR THE DATA ENGINEER @ BEERWULF
No motivation letter, just a few questions for you to answer in the next step. We will take a look at your resume, so make sure it is shiny and bright. After a CV screen we ask you to make an assignment.
In the best case scenario, you will have two interviews before you’re hired. The first one will be with Breno and one of our Data Engineers. The second and final round is with Jason and HR .
Questions about this position? Send them to breno.boueri@beerwulf.com.
Still enthusiastic? Then hit that button and upload your resume!
Please do not make use of this vacancy as an acquisition opportunity

Job Description

Our product management department is the centre of our business. You know everything within your product group and are the category ambassador within the organisation.

Your Team And Responsibilities

As a Product Manager it is your goal to ensure continuous product availability for current and future loyalty programs worldwide. Together with your category sourcing team (Product Management, Sourcing and Quality) you are Brand Loyalty's knowledge center for the product ranges and concepts in the assigned categories. You know everything that is happening within your product groups. With the help of your category sourcing team it is your responsibility to manage these product categories including lead management, product development, and product data management. Your success will be in your ability to deal with challenges – such as changing requirements and fixed deadlines – and to keep developing and delivering the products needed, while keeping internal and external stakeholders informed.

Product knowledge center

You will be BL's knowledge center for all the products in the assigned categories. Together with your Category Sourcing Team you'll make sure the knowledge is built out and maintainedCategory management of existing ranges in the portfolio including licensed products and direct buys.Present product information and category plans to key internal and external teams in a comprehensive, clear and tactical manner.Category analysis based on programme performance.Monitoring external environment by visiting fairs/other relevant events.Execute product life cycle management (phase in/phase out decisions).
Product development

Together with Portfolio you initiate New product development and create the briefing for your category sourcing team.Act as project team leader in your category sourcing team where you cooperate with dedicated stakeholders to execute product development of new products.You are in contact with Brands and License partners for product- and program approval.Familiar with manufacturing process, costs and capabilities, partner with category sourcing team to ensure fast track timelines are embedded.Deliver the product ready to launch including packaging, pricing, positioning, passport and brand pack (in cooperation with Marketing)

Programme preparation, planning and executionConsult the Sales and Operations department in the lead management phase on product availability, product status and existing concept possibilities.Set up of the framework of the loyalty program from Sourcing side, working closely together in project teams with all internal departments involved.

Job Requirements

What qualities do you bring?

HBO or University Degree3+ years’ experience within a Product or Category management positionExpertise with consumer/household products, such as cookware, cutlery, dinnerware, glassware, kitchen utensils and storage products.Strong communication and interpersonal skills, open and proactive at all levels.Willingness to travel frequentlyExcellent English language skills, verbal and written.Knowledge of SAP is a plus
What do we offer?

Are you up for the challenge? BrandLoyalty wants you to have fun in your work, contribute to our growth and share the successes with your team/company. This is just a short list of what BrandLoyalty can offer you:

Happy people: happy colleagues, happy customers, happy clients!Personal & professional development opportunities within a multinational growth business.Work a team with 50+ nationalities in over 55 countries around the world.Part of a Fortune 500 company... with a young & agile attitude.Exceptional terms of employment – compensation, on-site gym with personal trainers, healthy daily lunches cooked by an in-house team and spectacular team gathering.
BrandLoyalty is known for being a diverse & inclusive workplace because we believe that this drives our purpose “Next Generation Happiness” and creates a better future every day for our employees, clients, and partners. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or disability.

Als Accountmanager Microsoft bij E-mergo word je uitgedaagd om Microsoft producten en diensten te verkopen. Je bezoekt (potentiële) klanten en onderhoud relaties. Je initieert acties om nieuwe prospects aan te trekken. Je bent hoofdverantwoordelijk voor de verdere uitbouw van ons portfolio op het gebied van Power BI en Power Apps en de Data en AI stack van Microsoft.
Je initieert en bewaakt de voortgang van Proof of Concepts op het vlak van Data en AI. Verder werk je samen met enthousiaste collega consultants die de door jou binnengehaalde opdrachten gaan uitvoeren en hou je de ontwikkelingen bij van branches waarbinnen onze klanten werkzaam zijn. Je begrijpt de waarde van de Compute en Storage propositie van Microsoft en weet dat te vertalen in commerciële kansen. Naast de end-user producten als Power BI en Power Apps bevinden die kansen zich ook aan de backend met cloud producten als Azure Datalake,-Datafactory, –Databricks en Azure SQL Datawarehouse en -Synapse.
Het E-mergo salesteam bestaat momenteel uit 4 personen, waarbij de focus is verdeeld over de productlijnen Qlik, TimeXtender, Microsoft en Mendix. Het totale team bestaat uit ruim 50 personen waarvan het merendeel consultant is. Op het gebied van Qlik en TimeXtender bekleden we een koppositie in Nederland en het is ons doel om dat voor de Microsoft productlijn ook te bereiken, onder andere door het huidige Gold Partnership uit te bouwen tot de Platinum status. Wil jij bijdragen aan dit succes? Lees dan snel de rest van de vacature en ontdek of wij de droombaan voor je hebben!
Over ons:De naam E-mergo is afkomstig van het Latijnse spreekwoord ‘luctor et emergo’ (ik worstel en kom boven). In Zeeland staat dit voor het overwinnen van de strijd tegen het water. Wij strijden natuurlijk niet tegen het water, maar we zorgen er wel voor dat bedrijven het hoofd boven water kunnen houden in de steeds groter wordende stroom van data. Onder het motto ‘Manage your data, innovate your business’ helpen wij organisaties het maximale om uit hun data te halen. Dit doen wij met behulp van Qlik, TimeXtender, Microsoft en Mendix, waarvoor wij software, consultancy en beheer leveren. Ons team maakt het mogelijk om samen met de business nieuwe verdienmodellen te creëren en kosten te besparen voor onze klanten.
E-mergo heeft in de Business Intelligence markt een unieke positie met betrekking tot BI software. Wij zijn al meer dan 5 jaar Elite partner van Qlik en Gold partner van Microsoft in Nederland en zijn de afgelopen twee jaar partner van het jaar geworden van TimeXtender in de Benelux. Met jou als Microsoft Accountmanager willen wij dit succes verder uitbouwen. Naast onze professionele werkzaamheden vinden wij het sociale aspect ook erg belangrijk. Zo gaan wij jaarlijks met een groep op wintersport en houden wij maandelijkse teammeetings. Hierbij ontstaat altijd een mix van inhoudelijke onderwerpen en collegiale gezelligheid.
Het aanbod:Je collega’s zijn ambitieus en gecertificeerd in hun specialisme. Wij zorgen ervoor dat je op de hoogte blijft van de laatste ontwikkelingen in de markt en dat er een cohesie ontstaat tussen de verschillende specialisaties. Het salaris dat je wordt geboden is absoluut marktconform bestaande uit vaste en variabele componenten. De sfeer is collegiaal, open en direct.Opleidingsmogelijkheden en veel aandacht voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.Hoogopgeleide, gecertificeerde collega’s die graag hun kennis met je delen.Plezierige en motiverende werkomgeving met ruimte voor initiatieven, humor en zelfontplooiing.Marktconform salaris met uitstekende bonusregelingSecundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals mobiele telefoon, laptop en auto van de zaak.Gezellige (digitale) borrels
Over jou:Afgeronde HBO of WO-studie met raakvlakken naar IT, Commercie en/of EconomieErvaring in het verkopen van softwareoplossingenErvaring met Business Intelligence oplossingen van Microsoft is een absolute préDe juiste onderhandelings-skills, weet deals te closen en straalt zelfvertrouwen uitGoede communicatieve vaardigheden, flexibel en zelf-startendEen winnende extraverte persoonlijkheid met de benodigde drive en enthousiasmeGevoel voor nieuwe opportunity’s en salesstrategieën en weet deze in de praktijk te brengen

Back End Software Developer Location: Delft, The Netherlands Who is Maana Electric?Maana Electric is an innovative startup which is using space industry technologies for the production of solar panels on Earth and in Space. Maana is specialized in ISRU technologies, metallurgy and semi-conductor physics for Terrestrial and Space applications.Maana aims to produce cheaper, better and emission free solar panels for Earth to accelerate the transition to clean & sustainable energy sources. With major growth expected, Maana is looking for individuals who like a challenge, are willing to grow with the company and share Maana’s vision for a sustainable future on Earth and development of a resource economy in space. Job DescriptionMaana Electric’s engineering team is looking to fill the role of a Back-End Software Developer. The main tasks for this position within Maana’s engineering team include: Develop a database and API for data storage and operation of both Terrestrial and Lunar hardware.Interfacing database and data retrieval hardware.Provide expertise into databases and servers requirements and design definition.Setting up, maintaining, and troubleshooting databases and servers.Ensure security and encryption is achieved throughout the data transfer chainDevelop a secure and private API.Design of data transfer and storage of 100s of data points.Develop a scalable database & back end architecture.Collaborating with specialists in other disciplines to support their data storage needs.Develop operations algorithms & perform machine learning on acquired data for improving hardware system operationsConduct extensive testing before deploymentDevelop a continuous software development methodology within the company.Support in the development of a Control Center for both Terrestrial and Lunar hardware.Communicate with telecoms companies for data transfer from in field systems to the Control center Qualifications:Master degree in Computer Science/Software Engineering or related engineering field.5+ years of working experience.Experienced in database management and encryption.Experienced in setting up new server environments.Experience with database programming languages (i.e. mysql, MongoDB).Experienced in setting up APIs.Experienced in C# programming.Experienced in building software testing frameworksGood written and oral communication in English. Dutch and other languages are considered an asset.Strong work ethics and passion to set and meet high performance standards.Ability to work alone and in a team.Able to set priorities and work under tight deadlines. Preferred: Experience in machine learning2-factor authenticationHands-on experience and knowledge with front end application development and GUIs.Good practical knowledge of .Net (.Net 4+, C#, Web API, ASP.Net MVC) is considered a plus.Experience in developing data analysis tools.Experience in supporting data center networks implementation.EU nationality or work permit for The Netherlands.  What we offer:Competitive salary package & benefits.Enthusiastic and motivated team.Friendly and innovation focused working environment.Flexibility and responsibility within the team.Ability to develop within the team as the company grows. Contact:If you are interested in the listed position, feel free to send us your CV and a short motivation to hr@maanaelectric.com If you have questions regarding other opportunities at Maana Electric, please send us your CV and questions to the same email address.

Job Description:
Ben jij er klaar voor om als Industrieel Elektrotechnisch Servicetechnicus de verantwoordelijkheid op je te nemen om de klanten van ENGIE zo min mogelijk productieverlies te laten leiden?  Functieomschrijving  Als industrieel servicetechnicus bij ENGIE krijg jij de sleutel van de voordeur van de fabriek in je hand en ben jij de essentiële in het voorschrijven van de continuïteit van het productieproces. De industrieën waarvoor wij werkzaam zijn produceren vol continue. ENGIE maakt voor klanten echt het verschil door ervoor te zorgen dat het productieproces minimaal verstoord wordt. Jij als ervaren servicetechnicus kan ieder moment opgeroepen worden om de meest voorkomende te verhelpen. Is er een technische opslag dan is de druk hoog en mag er geen onnodige tijd verspeeld worden, zonder dat je de veiligheid uit het oog verliest. Het is een hele verantwoordelijkheid om dit alles in goede banen te leiden. We kunnen ook niet ontkennen dat dit een grote uitdaging gaat zijn, maar wel een uitdaging waarbij je een tevreden klant hebt,  Geen dag is hetzelfde, iedere dag rijd jij met jouw auto naar een andere klant, naar een nieuwe storage. Wat kun jij je hier nou bij voorstellen? Wij nemen je mee in de week van de Servicetechnicus die op dit moment een storingsdienst draait.  Vrijdag aan het einde van de dag ontvang je de storingskoffer.  Zaterdag: Geen opslag gehad Zondag: Er is een store bij een klant om 19: 30u. Je rijdt naar de klant, analyseert en verhelpt de opslag. Je stelt een storingsrapport op en adviseert de klant hoe hij de volgende keer een storage als deze kan voorkomen. Je rijdt weer naar huis en laat een tevreden klant achter. Maandag: Je belt met een klant om te horen welke werkzaamheden op deze dag moeten worden. Je voert deze werkzaamheden uit en koppelt deze terug naar de klant of een coördinerende collega. Dinsdag: Je gaat op bezoek bij een andere klant om een inspectie uit te voeren. Je stelt het rapport op en bespreekt dit met de klant. Als het kan voer je de inspectie die dag nog uit of je maakt een afspraak wanneer het dan wel uitgevoerd kan worden.  Woensdag: Je bent in de nacht dinsdag op woensdag opgeroepen om een storing op te lossen. Je hebt natuurlijk je rustperiode van 8 uur dus je start vandaag om 10u op kantoor. Samen met je leidinggevende worden je werkzaamheden aangepast aan je rooster.  Donderdag: Er is een fabrieksstop, dat betekent tijddruk! Je voert hier vandaag werkzaamheden conform planning uit. De dag eindigt als de fabriek weer in bedrijf is.  Vrijdag: Je springt bij op de afdeling projecten om te zorgen dat hun werkzaamheden op tijd afgerond kunnen worden waardoor achterstanden voorkomen worden.  Je draagt de storingskoffer over aan je collega aangezien hij de dienst overneemt voor de komende week. Verder wordt kort met jou doorgesproken wat er aan storingen gebeurd is afgelopen week. Voor aankomende week houd je rekening met een NEN3140 training.  Industrieel Elektrotechnisch Servicetechnicus bij ENGIE is geen baan, maar een carrière.  Het ideale plaatje voor ons is dat jij als Servicetechnicus de expertise en ervaring hebt om complexe storingen zelfstandig op een efficiënte en duurzame manier op te lossen en dat de klant hier zo min mogelijk last van heeft. Daarnaast zien onze klanten graag dat je meedenkt en slimme ideeën aandraagt, bijvoorbeeld hoe voorkomen we dat de storing nogmaals optreedt. ENGIE gaat graag een langdurige relatie met jou aan, en investeert in deze relatie met uitdagende werkzaamheden bij vooraanstaande klanten maar ook door jou middels training op de hoogte te houden of brengen van de benodigde kennis en kunde.  Daarnaast biedt ENGIE de mogelijkheid om je te verbreden binnen een ander onderdeel van het bedrijf, bv richting utiliteit, energie of een ander deel van ENGIE. Je kunt doorgroeien naar b.v. werkvoorbereider, inspecteur, commissioning engineer, beheertechnicus van één of meerdere installaties of andere.  Wat breng je mee      Bewust zijn voor veiligheid en hier ook voor staan. Bij ENGIE doen we het veilig, of we doen het niet.   Drive om de problemen op te lossen en de klant tevreden achter te laten, onafhankelijk van het tijdstip. Als onderhoudsmonteur krijg jij niet zomaar de sleutel van de voordeur van de fabriek, dat houdt ook in dat wanneer er een storing is, er een beroep op jou gedaan kan worden. Om dit eerlijk te verdelen wordt er een consignatie dienst gelopen.  Communicatieve vaardigheden. ENGIE is een dienstverlenende organisatie, waarin jij hét visitekaartje bent. Je bent in staat zijn om jouw manier van communiceren aan te passen op de situatie waar jij op dat moment in bevindt; Naast het feit dat jij vaardig bent in het communiceren met diverse stakeholders, ben jij ook in staat om jouw bevindingen in een rapport of iets dergelijks te verwerken.   Aanpassingsvermogen. Om de werkzaamheden goed te kunnen uitvoeren is het belangrijk om te schakelen tussen diverse taken en dat je kunt bepalen waar de prioriteiten liggen;  Wil tot zelf ontwikkeling om samen met ENGIE jouw carrière naar het volgende niveau te tillen;  Teamspirit. Je bent onderdeel van een team storing monteurs en jij krijgt er energie van als je hoort dat team de klus geklaard heeft en een tevreden klant heeft achtergelaten;   Je krijgt er energie van de juiste oplossing te vinden. Je denkt ‘’out of the box “ en je neemt je verantwoordelijkheid voor de uitgevoerde werkzaamheden;  Minimaal een afgeronde mbo-4 opleiding afgerond in de richting van elektrotechniek of iets vergelijkbaars. Dit maakt werken bij ENGIE voor jou als Servicetechnicus zeker de moeite waard Je komt terecht in een groep gelijkgestemden: mensen die bezeten zijn van techniek. Je kunt bij ons de hele dag over techniek praten, als je dat wilt. We zijn nuchter en zien onze duurzaamheid vooral tot uiting komen in de relaties die we met onze klanten hebben opgebouwd. Dit resulteert in nieuwe uitdagingen en langdurige klussen die complexer zijn, en dus meer van je vragen. Je krijgt dan ook de kans om nieuwe methodieken uit te proberen en jezelf verder te ontwikkelen. Het mooie is ook dat we zelf eigen techneuten in dienst hebben en onze expertise steeds verder kunnen uitbouwen.  Daarnaast kan je rekenen op  Een passend salaris, afgestemd op je achtergrond en ervaring  Mooie arbeidsvoorwaarden, een goede pensioenregeling, een collectieve zorgverzekering, 25 vakantiedagen en 13 adv-dagen  De mogelijkheid om door te groeien naar een senior functie als leidinggevende, werkvoorbereider of coördinator  Groei op persoonlijk en professioneel vlak mbv cursussen en opleidingen  Een prettige werksfeer en goed onderling contact met leuke collega's  Wil jij met ons samenwerken aan een veilige en groene toekomst?  
﻿CONTACTINFORMATIE Spreekt de vacature je aan? Voor vragen kan je contact opnemen met Lilian van Son op06 12618394 of per mail lilian.van.son@engie.com

Hoe maak jij het verschil

Het state-of-the-art geautomatiseerde order storage & retrieval (OSR) systeem en bijbehorende componenten van Knapp is één van de grootste en belangrijkste schakels in ons proces. Jij zorgt voor het onderhoud aan de OSR en bijbehorende systemen. Wanneer de OSR goed werkt, kunnen we onze belofte aan de klant waarmaken!

Concreet zorg je voor

het effectief en efficiënt verrichten van storingsanalyse, reparaties en onderhoud aan alle proces en productie gebonden installaties onsite op een veilige manier;het geven van instructies en advies over de werking en veiligheid van de apparatuur;het inventariseren, signaleren en communiceren van (technische) problemen en het niet optimaal functioneren van de apparatuur;het oplossen van problemen en het doen van verbeteringsvoorstellen ter voorkoming van problemen en/of het verbeteren van de werking van de apparatuur (continuous improvement).

Wat breng je mee en wat zetten wij hier tegenover

Je brengt het volgende mee

Je hebt tenminste een afgeronde MBO-3 opleiding, richting Werktuigbouwkunde, Elektrotechniek en/of Mechatronica;Je beschikt over minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring als (zelfstandig) onderhouds- en storingsmonteur, bij voorkeur in een material handling omgeving;Je spreekt Nederlands (goede spreek- en schrijfvaardigheid), Engels (voldoende spreek- en schrijfvaardigheid);Je bent flexibel, bereid om in ploegen en buiten normale werkuren te werken;Je bent pro-actief, resultaat- en oplossingsgericht, flexibel, teamgericht, communicatief vaardig en stressbestendig.

Red Bee was born in media and for the past 15+ years we have made significant contributions to the development of the global media industry, empowering the world’s strongest media brands, broadcasters and content owners to instantly connect with audiences anywhere at anytime. At Red Bee, you get to be a part of shaping the future of the media industry and deliver amazing media experiences to global audiences. Our partners include: BBC, Channel 4, ITV, Canal+, Extreme E, TV5MONDE and many others.

Our Exciting Opportunity

The Infrastructure Operations Team is responsible for maintaining and supporting the global network, storage and compute infrastructure across all sites, ensuring a world class service is delivered for our customers.

This role will support the Global Head of Infrastructure Operations and will own the local site infrastructure, ensuring all standards, SLA’s & requirements are met for the business.

The environment is diverse with a mix of both current and legacy platforms. As such you will take ownership for a number of services covering network, storage, compute & virtualisation.

We have a superb opportunity for someone looking to advance their career into operational leadership while still maintaining a technical aspect.

You will

Collaborate with the local Operation and Technology Solutions leads, managing the infrastructure to ensure the effective delivery and support of high quality internal IT services to meet the required SLAs for service deliverySupport user-centric products - bringing passion for excellence, encourage teams to achieve better results for our users and customers and understand the detail of the local services provided and how this relates to the infrastructureDevelop infrastructure processes, documentation and policies, execute locally, apply IT strategy & lead change. Engage collaboratively with other Infrastructure and technology teams across the organisationIncident and problem management, tracking from inception to communication and resolution within agreed timescalesAct as an emergency 24x7 communication point for issuesProvide technical expertise to major incident root cause analysis and customer facing meetings as requiredLiaise with Infrastructure teams and manage relationships with 3rd party vendors for support where necessaryHelp to define and maintain the annual Operational IT budgets and ensure that financial targets are met.

To be successful in the role you must have

First class leadership abilities: leading by example, with a track record of empowering direct & remote teams to perform at a high levelExperience of delivering against a rapidly changing technical environment, requiring a flexible and ‘can do’ attitude, even when there is unclear directionUnderstanding and appreciation of ITIL Service Management and Project methodologiesExtensive experience and knowledge of:Core VMware and Microsoft technologies from an architecture and administration perspective (AD, Windows Server & client OS’s, clustering, DNS/DHCP, PKI, SQL AO clusters, PowerShell, deploying and supporting VMware platforms), with an understanding of network technologies

What´s in it for you?

By joining us you will be a part of an international team, collaborating to deliver amazing media experiences through forward-thinking solutions and services! You will work with colleagues who share a passion for media and clear sense of integrity in the workplace. In your day to day, you will have the opportunity to work with some of the biggest and most innovative media companies in the world, using cutting edge media technologies and systems to deliver our services. Here, you can bring your unique talents, skills and perspectives to the table and cooperate in an openminded an inclusive environment!

Do you believe that an organization fostering an environment of cooperation and collaboration to execute with speed creates better business value? Do you value a culture of humanness, where fact based decisions are important and our people are encouraged to speak up? Do you believe that diverse, inclusive teams drive performance and innovation? At Ericsson, we do.

We provide equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, religion, political opinion, nationality, ethnic background, social origin, social status, indigenous status, disability, age, union membership or employee representation and any other characteristic protected by local law or Ericsson’s Code of Business Ethics.

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.

Are you looking to join a team where you help customers use the latest technology, where you receive innovative training and where you´re empowered to make a difference? Do you put your customers at the center of everything you do? Are you eager to learn to drive the highest technical quality? Do you like to work with best-in-class cloud technologies and do you have a passion to help customers adopt cloud and build solid a cloud foundation?

If so, the Customer Engineer position is for you! We need enthusiastic people to provide technical leadership to our customers. You work at customers in the Netherlands and Europe, both on-site and remotely.

Customer Engineers (CEs) are deep technical advisors supporting and enabling our Enterprise customers with Azure. Using your passion for technology you educate and assists customers to develop and deploy their applications and make sure they run healthy and efficient. You assess their solutions to find potential issues, threats and areas for improvement and work with them to solve these us. When a customer faces significant issues, you step in to use your technical depth to find the cause and suggest a solution.

Responsibilities

You will also be involved in wider Support Execution which means lots of teamwork to help our customers (and your colleagues) to be more successful. Therefore, we look for people who enjoy collaboration and can spot opportunities in their customers for developing even greater business value and grow those customer/partner relationships effectively. Other interesting areas would be to develop awareness of competition, modifying IP and creating new content.

About half your time will be spent in Support Management activities such as spotting performance issues, analysis of customer needs and dealing with any technical issues or problems and solving them. You’ll be part of a larger virtual account team and get to work in partnership with them to strengthen targeted customer relationships and work on immediate and long-term service delivery plans.

With your passion you will motivate others and yourself to drive the vision of changing the world to a better one through the power of the cloud.

With your spirit and your ideas, you will strive to be a role model and help our customers to understand the advantage of the latest technologies and you will help to improve their existing IT-environment.

You will act as an entrepreneur and as an evangelist internally and externally and will drive the value proposition of Azure with every action you take.

Qualifications

We are looking for engineers with an understanding of cloud concepts and technology and experience in supporting optimizing cloud workloads in production. Additional skills in specific cloud related components, like networking, identity, security or automation is a benefit, however the role is specifically targeted for expertise on cloud networking or storage services.

You have or are eager to develop the following skills:
Excellent written, oral and presentation skillsFluent in Dutch and proficient in EnglishExperience in the enterprise customer arena/face-to-face customer engagement skillsConfidence to work with engineering teams and technical decision makersKnowledge about Microsoft Azure solutions and offeringsDiagnosing and troubleshooting IT issues.
To set yourself up for success in this role we are looking for a solid grounding in systems development, network operations, software support or IT consulting, with preferably 1-5 years of working experience.

We believe that everyone can grow and develop. We succeed as a team by sharing knowledge and experience. Don’t worry about what you don’t know; come and show us what you do know, and we will teach you the rest.

Bachelor’s Degree (B.S./B.A.) or equivalent is desirable.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Vandebron is a scale-up in the energy world, with a mission to transform the energy market, starting with 100% green and local energy in the Netherlands. We are doing so by using state of the art technology that helps us distinguish ourselves from other utility providers. Our Digital Platform team is looking for a DevOps Engineer to support our IT infrastructure. We provide the platform within Vandebron where our Developers can deploy their applications on. We manage the cloud infrastructure, maintain the container platforms and handle the clusters that deliver Vandebron’s services.  What does the job entail?We use various open source tools in our infrastructure running on AWS and Azure. We do not expect you to have all of these skills, but experience with/willingness to learn these tools is part of this position. The tools we use in our environment: 
In our infrastructure-as-code we use Terraform to deploy our infrastructure to AWS and Azure. Ansible is used for our configuration management, we are building our images with Packer and our secrets are in Vault.Our infrastructure core components are on Mesos/DCOS, we are in the middle of a migration to Kubernetes. In our DevOps culture we assist Developers deploying their services securely and highly available. We provide them with advice, we monitor and help improve our services. When we deploy applications that hold state we mainly use NoSQL, databases or storage solutions, examples; Cassandra, CockroachDB, MongoDB, Elastic, MySQL, Postgres, S3. Our team is responsible for managing these solutions. Our metrics are collected in a Prometheus/Grafana setup, our Logs are in an ELK setup.In our environment we run Spark workloads on Autoscaling spot instances, part of these workloads are started in NiFi.We support our Data scientists with setting up Jupyter notebooks. Developers within Vandebron use Scala, Python and TypeScript.We use 3 proxy/load balancing solutions: HAProxy, Traefik and NGINX.

What is your profile?You have previous experience with container cluster technologies, preferably Kubernetes.You are able to automate your solutions in either a bash script or in the automation tooling we use. Experience with Golang or Python is a big plus.You preferably have previous experience with JVM. Grit; perseverance and passion for long-term goalsAbility to handle a dynamic environmentFamiliarity with DevOps culture. 

What do we offer?The experience of contributing to changing the world for the better.An ambitious, innovative, and fun work environment.Room for your own initiative.Salary in conformity with the market.Daily fresh organic lunches (if possible again).An office in the heart of Amsterdam (if possible again).Friday drinks, company and team building events (if possible again).A discount on your Vandebron energy contract.Personal development budget of 750,- per year, available after 6 months in service.
Interested?Please press the button below and tell us who you are and why you want to work with us!

Dataiku allows enterprises to create value with their data in a human-centered way while breaking down silos and encouraging collaboration. One of the most unique characteristics of our product, Data Science Studio (DSS), is the breadth of its scope and the fact that it caters both to technical and non-technical users. Through DSS, we aim to empower people through data and democratize data science.

Role

This role consists in supporting Dataiku’s pre-sales efforts along the following three categories

Dataiku is looking for an experienced software sales specialist to join as a Senior Sales Engineer based in Amsterdam, supporting our growth in the Northern Europe area. We’re looking for someone who can express passion about the AI domain and communicate this passion to our customers.

Building Interest in Dataiku
Positioning the value of our technology in front of prospective clientsBuilding and delivering demonstrations of the project, on data and use cases relevant to the prospect, and to their specific circumstances

Building Solutions in Dataiku: Sales Engineers are the primary builders of solutions that match the customer’s needs with the capabilities of our technology, which require...
Knowledge of adjacent technologies in the Big Data and Analytics spaceKnowledge of competing analytics and data science platforms and their respective strengths and weaknessesThe ability to communicate the capabilities of Dataiku's technology in great depthSkill at conveying the value at which Dataiku's technology has delivered to other customers through in-depth knowledge of use cases and user stories

Building Evaluations of Dataiku : The Sales Engineer supports prospective clients that wish to evaluate our technology by...
Structuring evaluations by identifying the core capabilities that need to be tested, and defining the most efficient way for them to be testedBuilding the evaluation project plan, with detailed timelines and responsibilitiesMarshaling the necessary resources from within Dataiku and the client organization in order to ensure that the evaluation progresses efficientlyMonitoring and ensuring that the evaluation goes to plan, and addressing any issues that may come up during the evaluationDataiku is a young company with great momentum and at this phase of very rapid growth, the Sales Engineer is likely to work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Product Management, and Engineering, as well as be a key player in supporting Dataiku's strategy in Northern Europe.

Responsibilities
Define and present the differentiated value proposition of the usage of the Dataiku offering in the technical and functional context of a prospect / customer.Define the evaluation process of the software(s) in prospect / customer contextIs the main technical touchpoint for the customer / prospect and for the sales team.Work with multiple Account Executives & partners to support opportunity qualification processDirect presentations to prospective customers and partners using knowledge of industry trends and standards and common industry challenges coupled with Dataiku solution knowledgePrepare the technical responses during the RFP and RFI processDrive the process of delivering high-quality product and architecture presentations and demonstrationsDemonstrate advanced product conceptsTrain partners and customers on products and features and assist in implementation of the product.Customize and present Customer Presentations for every Customer/Industry/RoleEnsure to follow up on problems and process independently related to solutions engineering whatever in pre-sale or implementation capacity ensuring excellent customer experience.Lead validation and implementation of technical requirements with customers ensuring smooth deployment of solutions, working with the R&D & Operations. Assist account teams in ensuring customer satisfaction

Requirements
3+ years direct experience in Analytics/AI or other enterprise softwareExperience in complex / large-scale enterprise analytics deploymentExperience in Python is a plusFamiliarity with data storage and computing infrastructure for data of all sizes (SQL, NoSQL, Kubernetes, Spark, etc)Good understanding of at least one cloud vendor offering (storage and compute)Knowledge of machine learning libraries and techniquesExperience with visualization and dashboarding solutionsGreat communication and public speaking skills including the ability to promote our software through smart blog posts, meet-ups and speaker engagementsAbility to travel 10 to 40%

Benefits
Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the companyCompetitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacationOpportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven teamDataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness

To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. Spanning from Sydney to Frankfurt, Denver to London, geography doesn’t stop Dataikers from working closely together and sharing experiences. Collaboration is key within our product and culture. We strive to create a sense of belonging and community while fostering diverse thinking by encouraging cross-team, cross-office interactions like our annual company offsite or Paris onboarding. Fly over to Twitter , LinkedIn , and Instagram to read stories about our culture, people, and success.

Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity, decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment.

 Location:  The Netherlands, preferably in/around Hilversum

 NEC Smart Enterprise Solutions

NEC Smart Enterprise Solutions provides IT & Communication solutions to small, medium and large enterprises in both the private and public sectors. Designed for open connectivity, high availability and flexible growth, our innovative solutions incorporate the latest voice, data and video technologies and enable real-time, collaborative working, increased productivity and customer satisfaction. Our servers, storage solutions, software and virtualized workstations enable businesses to maximize operational efficiency, performance and profitability.
With our NEC UNIVERGE BLUE Cloud Services, we are able to integrate all of our customers business communications in an efficient and reliable way. Currently we are looking for a dynamic and highly motivated candidate for the following position:

 Logistics Operations Employee Cloud (UBLUE)

Job Description

This job role is an exciting opportunity for ambitious (starting) candidates.

The Logistics Operations Employee Cloud will report directly to the Director Customer Operations & SCM, and will be responsible/accountable for controlling and managing the Hardware order fulfilment process from the moment of Business Partner (Customer) Order received until the moment of delivery.
Besides that, the Logistics Operations Employee Cloud takes care of the Partner boarding process, providing all necessary documentation and information regarding the delivery and he/she is the first point of contact for the Business Partner (Customer) regarding these SCM-related matters.
Concluded, the Logistics Operations Employee Cloud will manage the goods return process and is taking care of correct UBLUE/Cloud Data Management (Products & Pricing) in the applicable IT systems.

The ideal candidate for this role is someone who understands the principals of Supply Chain Management, is eager to learn and has a hands-on mentality. Candidate has demonstrated to be an accurate multi-tasker with a strong Customer focus and strive for process improvement and automation.
Being part of a corporate international organization will give the right candidate growth possibilities in the future in knowledge, experience and responsibilities.

Job Responsibilities

Logistics related activities
  Responsible for the logistic operation of HW delivery regarding the UBLUE (Cloud) value proposition;   Business Partner Boarding;   Registering, scheduling, releasing and confirming Sales & Purchase Orders;   Invoicing of Sales Orders and provide information to determine Pricing and take care of Data Management (maintenance);   Coordination in dialogue with colleagues after prioritizing and scheduling;   Conducts meetings with Sales, and is aware of strategy, interestsand priorities in business of the Sales group;   Resolves logistic and quality complaints and takes appropriate actions to avoid recurrence;   Participates in projects to constantly improve logistic processes (automation).

Professional Key Skills And Experience
  Professional Education (MBO+/HBO) degree or equivalent and 2-3 years of working experience;   Knowledge of and proven experience in relevant domains;   General knowledge of business & financial processes;   Good knowledge of the English language (both spoken and written);   Experience with ERP software (SAP, etc.), MSFT Office;   Accurate, flexible, hands-on, pro-active, able to work independently as well as in team, strong feedback skills;   Confidential in dealing with sensitive matters.

Job Description:

Leidos is looking for experienced individuals to support our team on the Army Pre-positioned Stock Sets and Theater Sustainment Stocks, assigned to the APS-5 Kuwait program. This program is responsible for APS-5 operational readiness, Materiel Maintenance, Supply and Services, Transportation, accountability, Care of Supplies in Storage, and the associated logistics analysis and management functions that provide support throughout the Southwest Asia (SWA) Theater of Operations. Work on the contract will be performed at Camp Arifjan, Kuwait. This position is contingent upon contract award to Leidos.

Primary Responsibilities
The Logistics Manager is responsible for all supply operations performed under the contract.The Logistics Manager will manage a team of logisticians, supply chain analysts, the data analyst, the warehouse, and the tool room with the day to day mission of procuring, storing, issuing and maintaining CL IX stock for use by the maintenance section on the US Army vehicles.Create and brief logistics presentations for weekly IPTs.Report order status for sustainment of multiple Army platforms.Work with logistics team to establish minimum sparing levels and reorder points.Provide training on current inventory management systems to logistics team to ensure accurate inventory accountability.Work with procurement team and vendors to lower lead times for repairs and new purchases.Maintain the formal government accountable records for wholesale equipment, less CL VIII, stored or in a maintenance cycle at APS-3 sites using the AWRDS and LMP databases.

Basic Qualifications
The Logistics Manager must have a Bachelor's degree and at least eight years of supervisory experience in a military supply operation and a comprehensive knowledge of governing regulations, policies, and procedures.The Logistics Manager must have a comprehensive knowledge of Army supply shipping, receiving, warehousing, inventory processes, and related regulations.Intricate knowledge of analytical techniques and causative research skills to identify areas of needed emphasis to recommend improvements.The Logistics Manager must possess operational skill and knowledge of the automated supply systems utilized.The Logistics Manager is required to have a SECRET security clearance.

Preferred Qualifications
Possess the appropriate verbal and written communication skills to conduct meetings, prepare reports, create plans, and write working instructions necessary to execute procedures.
