You work closely with hybrid Inside Sales Account Managers and manage internal as well as external stakeholders, so strong communication and interpersonal skills is key. Senior Systeembeheerder
Almere (Dordrecht / Den Haag) – 40 uur per week

 Kom jij ervoor zorgen dat onze ICT-infrastructuur altijd functioneert én klaar is voor de toekomst? Dat lijkt ons top. Onze zelf ontwikkelde softwareomgeving draait op een in ons eigen beheer zijnde cloud in een dual data center oplossing die veel van jouw dynamische vaardigheden gaat vragen. Geen dag is hetzelfde –maar dat is jouw ding, toch? We kijken uit naar jouw motivatie!

Wat ga je doen?
 Je bent als senior systeembeheerder onderdeel van het ICT Operations team. Met een team van 15 collega’s werken jullie aan het (her)ontwerp van bedrijfsprocessen, het ICT-platform en de benodigde infrastructuur. Tegelijkertijd heb je uiteraard ook je eigen verantwoordelijkheden op het gebied van IT.

 Je wordt verantwoordelijk voor het beheren en verder ontwikkelen van onze nieuw gebouwde virtuele omgeving (de private cloud). Je draagt bij aan de volgende stappen naar ons toekomstbeeld: een Hybrid Cloud omgeving die gefundeerd is op een Software-Defined Storage oplossing van Datacore in combinatie met Microsoft Hyper-V 2019 server en VMWare.
 Tools als Nessus, Icinga en Splunk helpen je de omgeving te bewaken op beveiliging en logging. Met Microsoft System Center gaan we daarnaast de totale configuratie zoveel als mogelijk automatiseren en werken we toe naar een zero-downtime omgeving. Kortom: grote ambities en genoeg te doen!

Wat zijn je belangrijkste taken? Beheer van complexe infrastructuur en netwerk (Hyper-V, VMWare + Cisco). Incidenten-, wijzigings- en capaciteitsbeheer en beveiligingsmaatregelen én bewaking van het beveiligingsniveau. Werken met Windows 2016 én 2019 server. Office365, Azure AD. Diverse tooling zoals Nessus, Icinga en Splunk.
Wie ben je, en wat hopen we dat je meeneemt? Een afgeronde hbo-opleiding (bij voorkeur in de richting van Informatica) of hbo-werk- en -denkniveau. Minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring: je hebt kennis van Active Directory, Azure AD en Office365. Een rijbewijs B: want je zal ook bij nevenvestigingen in Dordrecht en Den Haag on-site werkzaamheden uitvoeren. En: last but not least, een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal. Verder ben je betrouwbaar, enthousiast, nauwkeurig, gestructureerd, flexibel en gezellig (je mag zelf bepalen op welke volgorde dit voorkomt in je karakter).
Wat bieden wij jou? Zelfstandige en afwisselende functie waarbij je jouw talenten verder kunt ontwikkelen. Marktconform salaris met een interessante bonusregeling. Pensioenregeling met een lage werknemersbijdrage. Minimaal 25 vakantiedagen en 2 extra bonusdagen afhankelijk van ziekteverzuim. Een mooi hoofdkantoor met lekkere koffie (en leuke collega’s) (maar ook de mogelijkheid om deels thuis te werken)!
Wie zijn wij?
 Wij zijn Infomedics en wij gaan voor zorgeloze zorg. We regelen de facturering en het debiteurenbeheer voor ruim 7.500 zorgaanbieders zodat zij zich kunnen concentreren op waar ze het best in zijn: het bieden van goede zorg. Elk jaar versturen we namens onze klanten meer dan 35 miljoen rekeningen naar zorgverzekeraars en zorgconsumenten en loopt er meer dan 3 miljard euro door onze boeken heen. En going strong: want we groeien nog steeds! Tegelijkertijd bouwen we iedere dag verder aan ons eigen state-of-the-art IT-systeem dat ervoor zorgt dat alle processen snel, effectief en veilig verlopen.

 Het werk doen we met zo’n 250 collega’s. Allemaal toppers, op allerlei afdelingen. Je mag jezelf zijn bij Infomedics, en wij zetten persoonlijke- en professionele groei, uitdaging en werkplezier voorop. We zeggen weleens: “Bring yourself”, en verblijd ons met jouw persoonlijkheid, kennis en kunde! Dan zorgen wij voor de rest.
 Sinds kort werken we volgens een nieuwe bedrijfsfilosofie: zo zijn we gestopt met de beoordelingsgesprekken en werken we samen naar een bedrijfscultuur waarin feedback geven en ontvangen heel belangrijk is, en waarin verantwoordelijkheid en zelforganisatie voorop staan.

 De sollicitatieprocedure
 Het eerste gesprek is met de direct leidinggevende en HR, daarna volgt een tweede gesprek. Een assessment (cognitieve capaciteiten- en persoonlijkheidstest) is onderdeel van de sollicitatieprocedure. Tevens kan personeelsscreening, binnen de geldende wet- en regelgeving, deel uitmaken van de sollicitatieprocedure. Daarnaast is het belangrijk om te weten dat het verkrijgen van een Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag (VOG) nodig is om de functie te kunnen vervullen.

Reageren
 Ben je enthousiast en geïnteresseerd in deze baan, stuur dan jouw CV met motivatie vandaag nog naar HR via de solliciteren knop. Wil je meer weten kijk dan op https://www.infomedics.nl/vacatures of bel met Warsha Ramkhelawan op 06 – 51 34 79 14.

Aan bureaus & recruiters: we got this. Profielen en cv’s die tóch ongevraagd worden toegezonden, zullen behandeld worden als directe sollicitaties van de kandidaat.

Functievereisten
 Jij herkent jezelf in de kernwaarden van Infomedics. Wij zijn gedreven om doelstellingen te halen en klantverwachtingen waar te maken en wij zijn wendbaar om groei mogelijk te maken. Het fundament van onze dienstverlening is het bieden van financiële betrouwbaarheid voor zorgaanbieders en de vertrouwelijkheid van patiëntgegevens. We zijn met elkaar verbonden, omdat iedereen zichzelf mag en kan zijn.

Interesse?
 Solliciteren kan via de sollicitatiebutton.

Je bent de specialist als het gaat om technologieën als VMWare ESXi, SAN storage, Microsoft platform en VDI. Er wordt gewerkt met VMWare ESXi omgeving in samenwerking met vCenter. De gehele Microsoft omgeving is gevirtualiseerd. Hierop draaien meerdere Active Directory domeinen. Er wordt gebruik gemaakt van Terminal servers, Applicatie servers, High availability servers. De hardware omgeving bestaat uit HP Blade systemen, met zowel lokale en SAN storage. Het netwerk is ingericht met over het algemeen Juniper/Hirschmann apparatuur. We zoeken een kandidaat met grote kennis en kunde in deze technieken en die in staat is om nieuwe ontwikkelingen te beheren en te implementeren. Deze persoon fungeert als vraagbaak voor de beheerorganisatie. Beheren van complexe omgevingen en projecten met verschillende stakeholders en ketenpartners is jouw dan ook niet onbekend.
Dit ga je doen:Beheer en monitoren van alle geïnstalleerde systemen en infrastructuur.Installatie, configuratie, testen en onderhouden van besturingssystemen, applicatiesoftware en systeembeheer tools.Proactief zorgen voor de hoogste niveaus van systemen en infrastructuur m.b.t. beschikbaarheid.Beheer en monitor alle geïnstalleerde systemen en infrastructuur.Besturingssystemen, applicatiesoftware en systeembeheerprogramma's installeren, configureren, testen en onderhouden.Monitor en test applicatie prestaties voor potentiële knelpunten, identificeer mogelijke oplossingen en werk met collega’s om deze correcties uit te voeren.Beveiligings-, backup- en redundantiestrategieën handhaven.Deelnemen aan het ontwerpen van informatie- en operationele ondersteuningssystemen.Zorg voor 2e en 3e lijns ondersteuning.Verbinding met leveranciers en ander IT-personeel voor probleemoplossing.
EisenMinimaal een HBO diplomaMinimaal 10 jaar werkervaring met applicatie, server- en desktoptechnologie waarvan 3 jaar in de industriële automatisering.Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met het begeleiden en coördineren van kleine teams.VMware Certified Professional 6 Data Center Virtualization gecertificeerd.MCSA 2012 of 2016 gecertificeerd.
Competenties Je bent communicatief vaardig;Je kunt goed zelfstandig werken;Je werkt nauwkeurig en begrijpt de noodzaak van documenteren;Je ben oplossingsgericht.
De opdracht is voor 36 uur per week en voor minimaal een jaar met optie tot verlengen.
Geïnteresseerd? • Stuur een opdrachtgerichte motivatie waarin je duidelijk verwijst naar je specifieke ervaring met de vereiste expertise inclusief cv.• Geef een indicatie van het gewenste salaris en / of uurtarief. • Geef duidelijk de beschikbaarheid en eventuele vakantiedagen aan.

The position
As a Material Coordinator, you will set-up storage structure on projects according the Van Oord guidelines and systems. Maintain the inventory on the project and on the Van Oord yards in the best possible way to support the company and execute the tasks in the most safely, effective and efficient manner, in compliance with all relevant requirements. This means that you will be working a rotation schedule of 6 - 4. Meaning you will be abroad / on site for a full 6 weeks and then off for 4.

Your Responsibilities
  Maintain the project stores on the Company yards incl. execution of periodical stock check through for instance Cycle Counts/Wall to Wall counts;   Manages the preparation (mock-up) and consolidation for projects on the Van Oord yards;   Receipt and verification of incoming materials against the purchase order and reporting any discrepancy;   The safe and efficient management of the stores / warehouse on site in line with QHSE policy;   Take care of proper storage of project materials, under the required conditions;   Maintaining stock records in accordance with Company procedures and system to ensure database is in control and updated on a daily basis;   Keeps track of permanent important items and temporary important items;   Manage inventory of Client supplied materials and inventory of rental equipment;   Receive and ensure retention and filing of all relevant documentation including shipping documents, delivery notes, MSDS’s and certificates;   Provide project team (on/offshore) with required information related to tracking and tracing of material and equipment;   Issuance out of inventory towards project per demand;   Monitor, inspect and register material deliveries;   Tracking and Tracing of materials and expediting;   Execution of periodical stock check through for instance Cycle Counts/Wall to Wall counts;   Perform a material reconciliation of all materials at the completion of a project, and ensure storage, disposal and/or return of surplus materials;   Preparation of shipping manifests / packing lists for de-mobilised materials and equipment;   Assist non STAR IPS users in creating requisitions and materials;   Pro-actively identify and introduce opportunities for improvement.

Job Requirements
  Customer oriented and works well with others;   High School degree (Dutch MBO) with speciality supply chain management;   2-3 years’ experience in logistics warehouse materials control processes in a maritime or offshore business environment;   Experience with setting-up storage structure on projects;   Punctually, proactive and accurate;   Experienced working safely around heavy materials and equipment;   Team player, ability to work well under pressure, and demonstrates ability to work independently.

We offer
Working in an international, high demanding and dynamic organisation, with the possibility to truly have impact on our business, people and environment. We offer a complete package with excellent secondary employment benefits. The package includes among other things
  a salary that matches your responsibilities and experience;   32 leave days of which a max. of 7 days can be appointed as collective leave days;   a pension scheme;   a variable bonus;   extensive learning and (personal) development possibilities;   an adequate travel allowance;   collective health insurance (optional);   flexible working hours.

Over Van Oord
Van Oord is a leading global contractor in dredging, hydraulic engineering and offshore projects (oil, gas and wind). We are an innovative partner for our clients and have been contributing to the infrastructure of tomorrow's world for over a hundred years. Our people are committed, enterprising professionals with a passion for water and technology.

Loop jij warm voor een afwisselende functie met een uitgebreid takenpakket? Ter versterking van de Operation Control Room zijn wij op zoek naar een gedreven systeembeheerder.
Wat ga je doen?
Als systeembeheerder van de Operation Control Room (OCR) houd je je bezig met de monitoring en standaard beheertaken. Het is een afwisselende functie met een uitgebreid takenpakket. Door middel van gestandaardiseerde component-, dienst- en hardware monitoring bewaak je de(server)infrastructuur en -beveiliging. Je signaleert, analyseert en verhelpt storingen en verzorgt, indien nodig, de tweedelijns support. Verder lever je een bijdrage aan het capaciteitsbeheer en ondersteun je het wijzigingsbeheer. Je beheert het serverbeheersysteem en maakt rapportages. Regelmatig heb je contact met leveranciers over storingen en de aflevering van apparatuur. Het uitvoeren van testroutines behoort ook tot je werkzaamheden. Je ondersteunt in voorkomende gevallen in (implementatie)projecten en registreert en bewaakt lopende issues. Je bent betrokken bij de verbetering van de inrichting van het business service monitoring model.
Waar ga je werken?
Je werklocatie is Driebergen. De productlijn BeheerTooling-OCR is verantwoordelijk voor het bouwen, implementeren en monitoren van alle operationele onderdelen binnen de infrastructuur. Je maakt deel uit van het OCR-team. De OCR monitort alle componenten die in beheer zijn van de sector levering. Zij zorgt voor het continu monitoren van de systemen, applicaties en diensten, uitvoeren van werkinstructies en het uitvoeren van standaard beheertaken in de infrastructuur. Dit alles met het doel de operationele systemen van de politie 24/7 beschikbaar te houden voor in totaal zo’n 80.00 eindgebruikers.
Wie ben jij?
We zoeken een toegewijde collega met een sterk leervermogen. Nieuwe technieken en werkwijzen pas je snel en effectief toe. Je bent klantgericht en accuraat in het registreren van problemen. Je bent communicatief vaardig en weet je boodschap helder over te brengen. Met jouw kennis weet je zaken te verhelderen en vind je al snel de juiste oplossing. Je weet risico’s in te schatten en mogelijke problemen te signaleren. Je bent alert op onregelmatigheden en door rustig te blijven, de feiten te overzien en situaties te analyseren weet jij wat je te doen staat. Samenwerken is je op het lijf geschreven en voor jou is het geen probleem om mee te draaien in een 24/7 ploegendienst.

Daar heb je het volgende voor nodig

een afgeronde mbo 3 opleiding, bij voorkeur in de richting Informatica; kennis van en ervaring met operationeel beheer; generieke kennis van Unix, Storage, Windows, databases netwerken; fundamentele kennis van ITIL. Wat wij bieden
De standplaats is Driebergen. Er is ruimte voor 1 fte. Het betreft een functie voor 36 uur per week. Omdat goede mensen belangrijk zijn binnen de politie investeren we in jouw toekomst. We bieden uitgebreide ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden en een vaste aanstelling, waarbij een proeftijd van één jaar van toepassing is.

Verder kun je het volgende van ons verwachten

een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 2.060,- en maximaal € 3.425,- (schaal 7 Bbp) op basis van een 36-urige werkweek; 8% vakantie- en 8,33% eindejaarsuitkering; goede pensioenregeling en betaald ouderschapsverlof ( meer info over verlof, regelingen en mogelijkheden ).
De formele functie binnen het functiegebouw van de politie is medewerker techniek B , werkterrein informatie- en communicatietechnologie.
Interesse?
Bel of mail met Jolandi Schreuder, ICT recruiter (06 - 18 16 88 88, j olandi.schreuder@politie.nl ) als je meer informatie wilt hebben.

Solliciteer uiterlijk 25 maart 2021 via de sollicitatiebutton.
Wat verder belangrijk is
Een veiligheidsonderzoek maakt deel uit van de selectieprocedure. De politie zet in op vernieuwing en cultuurverschillen binnen teams. Divers samengestelde teams presteren beter. Daarom werken we hard aan een open en veilige cultuur waarin divers talent tot bloei komt. Zonder IT'ers zijn we nergens. Ben jij expert in IT? Lees alles over o.a. data science, legaal hacken of cybersecurity en test je digitale skills in de Cybercrime Challenge op http//it.kombijdepolitie.nl/

Innovation Supervisor
The Netherlands (Breda)

This is NewCold
NewCold is service provider in cold chain logistics with a focus on the development and operation of large, highly automated cold stores. By offering advanced logistic services worldwide, NewCold strives to be crucial in the cold chain of leading food companies. We use latest technology to empower our people, to handle food responsibly and to guarantee food safety in a sustainable way. We challenge the industry, believe in long-term partnerships and deliver solid investment opportunities that enable next generation logistic solutions.

NewCold is one of the fastest growing companies in cold chain logistics. We are expanding our teams to support this growth. More information on NewCold can be found on www.newcold.com and our social media.

About The Vacancy

To support our further worldwide growth, we are looking to recruit an Innovation Supervisor to join our innovation department. You will manage and support the NewCold innovation process flow with maintaining the dedicated innovation software and will be the linking pin between responsible innovation team leaders and the innovation process. You will be based in the company’s headquarters in Breda.

What will you do?
 Support development and management of the innovation strategy. Control and follow-up of the NewCold innovation process with continuous communicating with the team leaders and members. Maintaining and configuring the dedicated innovation software (Administrator rights). Managing the administration process including meeting minutes, team planning, monthly reports including KPI’s/data and other administration works required. Internal communication over innovation within the NewCold group. Support and develop the company wide mind set characteristics and framework to enhance the innovation process.
Who are we looking for?

In Addition You Have

You are an experienced innovation professional who is ready for the next step in his/her career. You are eager to learn new skills, share what you know, expand your network and contribute to the continued growth of NewCold.
 A relevant bachelor degree added with qualifications in innovation management. At least 4-7 years of work experience in innovation management. Convincing record of an active contribution to business improvement, automation and innovation. Comfortable working in a rapidly expanding organization. Highly proficient in English. Excellent analytical skills. A no-nonsense attitude.

Are you up for the job?
If you are interested in this vacancy and would like to apply, please make sure that you leave your CV in English. Suitable candidates will be invited for a first interview with our VP Continuous Improvement and Automation, a second interview will follow with a wider group of NewCold team members. Apply via the application form.

Why would you want to work for NewCold?
With the prospect of many new construction projects all over the world in the very near future, NewCold offers the opportunity to join a young but powerful company in the field of logistic services. We have the ambition and the potential to rapidly become the market leader in the field of modern and automated cold storage with additional supply chain services such as transport and distribution. Although our proposition comprises an attractive benefits and compensation package, the (international) scope, variety and impact of the position may appeal to you even more.

Can we welcome you on board as our new Innovation Supervisor to help us to continue our successful growth?

Agency calls are not appreciated.

Your role We are active in a multitude of sectors, such as, banking, insurance, retail and health. Here our team of data scientists and engineers makes a difference each day. Introduction For our ICT Department in Hoofddorp, we are looking for a Functional Application Manager with proven experience in business applications. Our ICT Department is responsible for the delivery, availability and maintenance of high quality ICT services for our employees in Hoofddorp, Aberdeen and offshore assets.

Organization

We are a leading provider of innovative Single Point Mooring systems (SPM) and operator of Floating Production Storage and Offloading units (FPSO). Since its foundation in 1978, We have built a technological lead specialising in design, development, lease and operation of tanker-based production and storage systems, and has become a leading provider of innovative Single Point Mooring systems.

We currently own and operates a number of Floating Production Storage and Offloading Systems (FPSOs): the Glas Dowr, the Aoka Mizu, the Bleo Holm, the Haewene Brim and Munin.

Function

As a Functional Application Manager, you will be responsible for all functional application management related to business processes and the interfaces with other applications and processes. You will form the bridge between the business and IT.

You Will
 Manage and optimise existing and new application functions Ensure the optimal use of the application by the users Configure and test functionality at user's request Develop, manage and optimise reports Ensure clear set up of the manuals Coordinate changes to applications Analyse processes and information flows Ensure the optimal level of knowledge of users, for example by giving in-house trainings for new employees Have the ability to translate functional requirements into technical solutions You are driven by your passion for supporting business processes with Information Management strategies and are willing to contribute to the further professionalisation of our business critical applications in a fast moving international environment You will be working from our office in Hoofddorp. If necessary, you are willing to perform activities abroad (on or off shore)

Requirements
 You have a relevant Bachelor's degree in IT (Bedrijfskundige Informatica) with 3 years of relevant working experience in application management and/or information analyses
 You have solid experience with the support of operational application landscape and end users and you can make the translation of business questions into functional and/or technical solutions. Furthermore, you already have knowledge of Document Control systems and Microsoft SharePoint in particular
 Fluent in Dutch and English, both written and spoken
 You take ownership and are reliable in delivering results. You are curious and stay up-to-date with developments. You solve bottlenecks, change approach if things are not working, and keep an eye on the balance between quality, costs and benefits
 You influence cooperation and ambiance in a positive way, values other


What We Offer
 A fulltime/40 hours per week position within an international environment Besides a competitive salary, you will receive a 13th month, holiday allowance and travel allowance 29 days of paid holiday annually and the opportunity to purchase 10 additional holidays annually The opportunity to take part in our collective health insurance scheme A good pension scheme of which we pay the complete pension contribution Onboarding program; we warmly welcome our new colleagues, so they feel home as soon as possible Different activities which are very divers and always voluntary, for example playing sports, CPC run, friday drinks, quiz night, Sail day and our annual Christmas party

Do you recognize yourself in the describtion above, please apply immediately!

It's rewarding to work at a company where YOU make a difference!  If you're passionate about the ever-changing IT industry and enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative progressive environment, you'll thrive at Tech Data!  Join our team to connect the world with the power of technology!

Ben je op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging in een dynamische en internationale organisatie? Heb jij affiniteit met de IT markt? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou! Kom werken bij de grootste (en leukste) IT-distributeur van Nederland: Tech Data! Nieuwsgierig geworden? Check dan snel deze vacature!

Wat je gaat doen

Wij zijn op zoek naar een commercieel talent dat ons HPE-team in Bodegraven komt versterken. Dit team houdt zich elke dag bezig met het adviseren van onze klanten over de HPE-portfolio. Jouw rol is met name het activeren van nieuwe HPE-resellers.

Het team bestaat uit 12 medewerkers waarbij men zich exclusief bezig houdt met het HPE product portfolio, bestaande uit servers, storage, networking en support business.

In de functie van Internal Sales is je hoofdtaak om omzet- en margedoelstellingen op individueel en teamniveau te bereiken en tegelijk een uitstekende service te bieden aan klanten van Tech Data. Je gaat nieuwe en ‘slapende’ accounts activeren en ondersteunen om zo meer bedrijfskansen te creëren en te helpen bij de ontwikkeling van nieuwe bedrijfskansen binnen het verkoopdomein van jouw team.

En daarnaast:

Ga je Tech Data op een efficiënte en professionele manier vertegenwoordigen;Bouw en onderhoud je uitstekende relaties met je collega’s en klanten;Help je jouw klanten op het gebied van bestellingen verwerken, productinformatie geven en offertes maken;Ben je verantwoordelijk voor het behalen van de gestelde targets;Zorg je er voor dat systemen up-to-date zijn;Bied je een service van uitzonderlijke kwaliteit aan;Zoek je samen met collega's naar nieuwe kansen bij bestaande accounts.
Jij:
Hebt HBO/MBO+ werk- en denkniveau of gelijkwaardig door ervaring;Hebt relevante verkoopervaring;Hebt een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal;Bent klantgericht, enthousiast en gedreven;Hebt affiniteit met ICT-producten;Neemt initiatief en hebt interpersoonlijke vaardigheden;Werkt graag in teamverband maar kan ook goed zelfstandig werken;Hebt uitstekende mondelinge en schriftelijke communicatieve vaardigheden.
Wij bieden:
Uitdagende werkzaamheden binnen een enthousiast en gedreven team;Trainingen en de mogelijkheid tot het behalen van certificaten van de aan jou toegewezen lijnen;Een marktconform salaris, 28 vakantiedagen, reiskosten en pensioen;Ruimte voor eigen initiatieven en ideeën;Leuke incentives;De mogelijkheid jezelf te ontwikkelen;Een eigentijdse werkplek met goede koffie en vers fruit.

The Next Generation Sequencing Sales Specialist is responsible for delivering revenue and driving growth in Europe for Twist Bioscience sequencing products. (S)he is accountable for delivering accurate revenue forecasts throughout the fiscal year, enabling the executive team to monitor business performance and drive decision making. (S)he is required to maintain knowledge of competitor products and their commercial strategies, identifying and escalating their activities in a time bound manner. (S)he is also accountable for providing customer feedback on Twist Bioscience products in addition to identifying unmet customer needs that will enable the development of new and innovative products.

What You'll Be Doing:
 Attain quarterly and annual revenue targets established from annual commission plans. Deliver accurate and timely forecasts for their territory. Develop and manage key relationships with new and existing customers at multiple organizational levels. Develop contingency and risk mitigation plans for their region as necessary. Develop and execute supply agreements to support new and existing business. Work collaboratively with product management, R&D and operations to minimize time to revenue. Maintain CRM database with up to date information Represent the company at relevant tradeshows. Maintain and raise awareness of the competitive landscape, provide customer feedback and introduce new product ideas to internal partners. Additional duties as assigned.
What You'll Bring to the Team:
 Proven track record of delivering financial targets on a quarterly and annual basis At least 5 years of experience of selling life science reagents and solutions. Experience selling next generation sequencing target enrichment products essential. Demonstrated technical knowledge of Next Generation Sequencing applications a necessity. A background in technical sales and support or field applications is preferred. Application of Salesforce.com a prerequisite. Ability to travel >50% is required
KEY ATTRIBUTES:
 Demonstrated drive determination and self-motivation resulting in consistent achievement of financial results. Demonstrated scientific problem solving skills. Demonstrated technical depth in sequencing workflows. Positive external and internal relationship management skills. Ability to participate with others as a member of the team to ensure that demanding and difficult projects are handled smoothly and cooperatively. Strong communication and presentation skills. Proven ability to thrive in a start-up/ change oriented environment. Proven coaching, mentoring, team-building and leadership skills. Proven as a strategic thinker, backed up by a track record of tactical execution.
EDUCATION:
  Bachelor's degree (B.A./B.S) from four year college or university preferred in Biology or similar field.

About Twist Bioscience

Twist Bioscience synthesizes genes from scratch, known as "writing" DNA. Just as children learn to both read and write, the next phase of development for the genomics revolution is the ability to write DNA.

At Twist Bioscience, we work in service of people who are changing the world for the better. In fields such as health care, agriculture, industrial chemicals and data storage, our unique silicon-based DNA Synthesis Platform provides precision at a scale that is otherwise unavailable to our customers.

Twist Bioscience Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Twist Bioscience Corporation provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic characteristics, or any other category protected by law.

GitHub is looking for engineers to join the Physical Infrastructure team within our Data Center Engineering organization. You will focus on the systems and tools that enable our engineers to operate and scale the world's largest code hosting platform. You will help maintain our physical platforms and automation framework, optimize our automated provisioning stack, and deploy systems at large scale around the world.

The Data Center Engineering team is highly distributed and you will thrive in an environment of remote work and asynchronous communication. You're expected to have strong written communication skills and be able to develop working relationships with coworkers in locations around the globe.

As an engineer at GitHub you'll always be challenged to solve interesting and novel problems that have real impact on how the world builds software.

Responsibilities:
 Design and implement systems to automate deploying, and managing, physical infrastructure.Build performant and efficient tools for managing provisioning of our global hardware platforms.Cultivate open source projects developed by GitHub and build things you are proud to share.Work closely with networking, compute foundations, database, and git storage teams to design and support our global data center presence.


Minimum Qualifications:
 Experience automating large, complex distributed systems with an eye toward reliability.Proficiency in Golang, Python, and/or Ruby.Experience diagnosing and resolving complex multi-system performance problems.Background working closely with physical datacenters, network engineering, and compute foundationsYou take a pragmatic approach to decision making and design choices.


Preferred Qualifications:
 Familiarity with configuration management software such as Puppet, Chef, Ansible, or Salt.Upstream contributions to relevant open source projects (i.e. Kubernetes, Nomad, Linux kernel).Experience with virtualization, bare metal deployment, or network engineering.Knowledge of the RedFish API, Opengear, and/or Zero Touch Provisioning.


Who We Are:

GitHub is the developer company. We make it easier for developers to be developers: to work together, to solve challenging problems, and to create the world’s most important technologies. We foster a collaborative community that can come together—as individuals and in teams—to create the future of software and make a difference in the world.

Leadership Principles:

Customer Obsessed - Trust by Default - Ship to Learn - Own the Outcome - Growth Mindset - Global Product, Global Team - Anything is Possible - Practice Kindness

At GitHub, we constantly strive to create an environment that allows our employees (Hubbers) to do the best work of their lives. We are also committed to keeping Hubbers healthy, motivated, focused and creative. We've designed our top-notch benefits program with these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we've built a place where we truly love working, we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Job Description
 We are searching for a suitable candidate to reinforce our Data Systems team as an Associate Scientist with main focus on implementing and administrating Smart QC and BSI systems. Smart QC is a non-GMP lab resource planning tool and BSI is a GMP digital inventory management system which will be used to manage the storage of GMP material administered by QCD.


 You will be part of the implementation team of both systems and will be responsible for system setup / master data configuration, user acceptance testing, training users and becoming a system SME and SKU. You will need to communicate with partners, troubleshoot issues and initiate improvements. You will maintain communication with the software vendors and / or with the global IT support team.


 You are able to work in a constantly evolving environment with short timelines, initiate improvements and ensure the most efficient use of our systems.
 Your main tasks and responsibilities will be:

Smart QC:

* be a member of the Smart QC implementation team, performing parameter and assay mapping into Smart QC together with assay & eLIMS SMEs
 * Write procedures, perform testing, train users
 * Troubleshoot and maintain the system as SME and Site Key User

2) BSI:
 * be a member of the BSI implementation team
 * Set up master data such as storage locations, label templates, etc.
 * Perform and document UAT according to GMP standards
 * Write procedures and train users
 * Troubleshoot and maintain the system as SME and SKU
 * Act as SME for Quality during regulatory inspections, internal and external GMP-audits.
 * Ensure compliance with quality standards (GMP) and production schedules.


 3) General Data Systems tasks:
 * Assist in eLIMS configuration and review
 * Assist in eLIMS SKU activities


Minimum Qualifications
 * Bachelor's degree in the biomedical field or equivalent
 * Strong affinity with digital systems
 * Experience with quality and laboratory systems such as cGMP, SAP and LIMS
 * Experience with project management is an advantage
 * Detail oriented, proactive
 * Good communication skills, able to connect to different partners and build strong relationships
 * Experience in the pharmaceutical industry is a pre
 * Experience working in a Quality driven environment, GMP experience is a n advantage
 * Experienced with laboratory management systems or at least high digital literacy.
 * Highly proficient in spoken and written English. Dutch is considered a strong plus.

Providing the software delivery platform to accelerate VodafoneZiggo teams

You are passionate about modern Software Delivery. Whether it’s code quality scanning, automated deployment or building a pipeline: you’ve done it all. You believe there’s always room for improvement and are eager to pioneer when it comes to new technology and techniques. You have a vision on the topic and know how to create a splendid service out of it. If this sounds familiar, we may be looking for you!

As a Productowner ‘CI/CD as a Service’, you live and breathe the “you build it, you run it” mantra. From providing new tools as-a-Service, providing teams with best practices on delivery or giving a training to a team in automation deployment; you enjoy enabling teams in their software delivery.

This Is How You Do It
 You have a vision on where we should move to and how to get there. You own and drive the service development roadmap and perform the PO role. You are very hands-on to the team, meaning you help set up and run CI/CD tools and underlying infrastructure on an enterprise scale. You have experience with the following technologies and techniques:
 VCS – Git (GitLab, Azure DevOps) Continuous Integration (CI) tools – eg. Jenkins, GitLab, Azure DevOps Artifact storage – eg. Artifactory Automated Provisioning/Deployment tools – eg. Ansible (Tower/AWX) Experience with working in an Agile Scrum team Experience with both configuring and running services (working in a DevOps team, monitoring CI/CD services) Experience with Docker and Container orchestrators (eg. K8S, OpenShift) Experience with cloud providers is a pre (AWS, Azure) Experience with automated software testing tools is a pre Experience with automated security testing tools is a pre   You lead by example when it comes to CI/CD by automating everything you do in code. You inspire teams to adopt automation and CI/CD practices through knowledge sharing and training sessions You document best practices in our internal knowledge base
You Strengthen
The Digital Engineering tribe is a cluster of platform teams that help and enable the software development teams in VodafoneZiggo. In the tribe you will be part of the ‘CD as a Service’ platform team. This is a cross-functional DevOps team fully focused on building the best CI/CD platform and providing the best help and support to the other teams. We have big dreams and ambitious goals we pursue. For this we working hard every day for the very best result. We challenge each other, help each other, continuously improve ourselves and have lots of fun along the way. Obviously as a professional you get a lots of freedom to shape your own work, responsibility and space to put your own ideas into practice.

Who We Are

VodafoneZiggo is a company of two strong Dutch companies who joined forces. Since January 2017, we have been a strong combination together in the Netherlands. As a communication provider we offer our customers the best in entertainment, mobile telephony, fixed telephony and internet. With our products and services we inspire people, companies and society to make contact. Whether on the road, at home or at work.

With more than 8000 employees, we are full of energy, ambitious and socially involved. Proud of what we perform and with whom we do this. With plenty of room for everyone to develop and take advantage of opportunities.

Our organization is rapidly and massively transforming itself to become more customer oriented, more adaptive, more responsive, more data-driven and more digital focused. This implies big changes to our IT and our way of working. The Digital Engineering tribe plays a crucial enabling role in this transformation.

Where do you meet your colleagues? A few examples
 At our frequent team- and tribe meetings. In the Ziggo Dome or during a party with all colleagues from VodafoneZiggo. For a drink or dinner near our central office, almost on top of the Central Station of Utrecht. How accessible do you want it to be?
You have it in you
A grounded person who keeps calm during busy days and is able to reflect this on others. When there is some quick solution thinking necessary, you already have some options in mind and ready to share it with the team. You know how to provide guidance to others, not just because you have the knowledge available but also because it comes naturally to you.

In Addition, You Have
 A proactive mind set and natural curiosity for new technologies Multiple years relevant experience

Tools And Platforms
 CI/CD and common used tools in the market: Bitbucket, GitLab, Jenkins, Ansible and SonarQube Containerization and container platforms: Docker, Kubernetes, Openshift Cloud-platforms like AWS and Azure OpenGroup IT4IT standard

Enjoy The Benefits

Based on a 40-hour work week at VodafoneZiggo, you can count on:
 An ambitious employer, who recognizes that when you develop, VodafoneZiggo develops. Which is why we offer education and training opportunities and provide possibilities to take your next career step(s) here, too 20 days paid vacation, with an option to buy up to 40 additional days off You also receive a monthly Benefit Budget of 14,95% of your gross salary; you can use this to put money aside for vacation plans, save up additional sabbatical leave, buy extra days off, or you can simply take the cash. The choice is yours! You get a voucher for a phone, and (of course) a Vodafone subscription to go with it. Which you are also welcome to use for private calls. As an ambassador of our organization, you obviously get discounts on Vodafone and Ziggo products With an eye to your retirement, we offer a pension scheme that also allows you to save for extra retirement income We offer an NS-Business Card of your choice, including the option of a 1st class train pass that you can also use privately If you want, you can work for us part-time  Flexibility: work when and where you perform at your best A great office environment, directly adjacent to Utrecht Central Station. Our Central Office is a work and meeting space for colleagues as well as customers, complete with an Experience Center and store We value social impact. You can take part in several initiatives in this area, during work time. For example the Online Masters program, in which you teach kids how to navigate the digital world responsibly We also offer good (financial) arrangements if you find yourself going through a rough patch, such as our disability plan And we offer discounts on health insurance, sports memberships, day care and more
You do it
Are you in? Now click on the application button and reply.

Water security drives economic growth, supports healthy ecosystems, and is fundamental for life. However, this critical resource can harm as well as help. Water-related hazards such as floods, storms, and droughts make up 90% of natural disasters. Climate change is expected to increase this risk and place even greater stress on scarce water supplies. Royal HaskoningDHV is actively contributing to creating a water secure world. We are therefore looking for you to join us in this effort.

International Project Manager Water Management

Do you have international track record in water management and flood & drought resilience? Are you looking for a very interesting new challenge? Do you want to have a leadership role in a very dynamic team working on developing our international project portfolio? Are you team player that enjoys mentoring motivated younger colleagues to further develop themselves as consultants? Then we invite you to apply for this job!

The position
As international project manager water management, you will play a leading role in the international projects within the Business Line Water. You will be leading or supporting more complex projects in the field (ground)water management and flood & drought resilience in cities and river basins. For example, we currently work on international projects like the Mekong Delta Integrated Regional Master Planning in Vietnam, a study on worldwide opportunities of water storage for the World Bank, and the flood resilience of Changi Airport in Singapore. As international project manager, you are responsible for internal management of budgets, risks, planning, contacts with clients, and contract management. You are able to attract clients with your added value and you actively contribute to our external business development by using your own (and our) network and contacts. You have a commercial mind-set and like to hunt for leads and proposals.

You will become a key contributor to international business development within the Advisory Group Water Management. You will work across the various advisory groups in the Business Line Water, to develop client relations and acquire international projects together with like-minded colleagues. Many of the international colleagues you will work with are based outside the Netherlands (in countries like Australia, Indonesia, Vietnam, Philippines, India, South-Africa, Mozambique, Poland and United Kingdom). We work as a team to achieve our goals, but Royal HaskoningDHV is also a company that very much stimulates and supports their staff to take initiative and self-manage. Your interest and motivation will determine how your career will develop, but we are sure you will enjoy the ride.

With your experience, you will play an important role as a mentor of younger colleagues and help them to develop their consultancy and project management skills. Leading by example and coaching will be an important, but also fun part of your work. But then again, there is also enough for you to learn, and we offer many possibilities to further develop your skills.

Your profile

You have a MSc or PhD degree in water resources, Hydrology, Physical Geography, Civil Engineering or comparableYou have over 10 years of international experience (outside your home country) and passion for projects in the field of (ground)water management, flood & drought resilience or similarYou have experience with management of international projectsYou have a demonstrated experience with business development in the public and private water sector (and strong external network and contacts in this sector) You are motivated to contribute to the innovation of our products and consultancyYou have excellent reporting and communication skills in English. Good reporting and communication skills in Dutch, French, Spanish or Portuguese are a plus You are willing to learn Dutch You are pragmatic and solution-orientedYou have a collaborative approach and enthusiasm in working together as team player with colleagues and clientsYou are stress resilient and flexible, and are motivated to frequently travel abroad on short trips if requiredIf you are applying from outside the Netherlands, you are willing to move to the Netherlands as the office location is in Amersfoort or Nijmegen

Our Offer
You will become part of company which is a global leader in the field of water management delivering eye catching local and international projects.

You will work together with colleagues with great consultancy skills and strong in connecting industry, environment, and society. This perfectly fits with RHDHV’s focus of “Enhancing Society Together”. In fact, RHDHV won in September 2020 the Global Water Awards for “Water Technology Company of the Year” for its significant contribution to water sector innovation

There are plenty of possibilities for growth in the role. Naturally, a beautiful company such as Royal HaskoningDHV offers many more development opportunities! We stimulate internal mobility and thus also autonomy in making development choices.

In addition to that, we are one of the largest Dutch engineering firms: innovative and realistic, perfectionistic and decisive, surprising, and reliable. Anytime and anywhere! That is Royal HaskoningDHV. Do you recognize yourself in this role? Then this might be your opportunity! You will have an excellent working atmosphere, working in a dynamic organization with around 100 direct colleagues in the Water Management advisory group, in which organizational and personal development take central stage.

Our assessment and rewarding will be based on your personal competences. We offer a wide array of personal development courses. Furthermore, you’ll receive an excellent package of flexible terms of employment.

The Procedure
Should you wish to know more about this position, please contact Rob Franken at: [email protected]

Job Description:
Overview

We now wish to recruit Lead Commissioning & Qualification Engineers for a Fill Finish Project based in Holland. Responsibilities
 Lead a team of commissioning & qualification engineers in the delivery of fill finish & associated production equipment( Freeze Dryers / Lyos, vial washers & tunnels, cappers, autoclaves, parts washers, storage vessels, etc.  Review of Commissioning, Qualification and Validation (CQV) documentation for fill finish & production equipment.  Field execution and supervision of Commissioning, Qualification and Validation (CQV) of process, equipment.  Attend regular client meetings to present on progress  Co-ordination of vendor packages to achieve streamlined CQV  Co-ordination/Review of construction packages to achieve streamlined CQV  Knowledge of recent regulations (ICH, ASTM, FDA, ISPE) and modern CQV practices

Qualifications
 Educated to degree level in Engineering, Architectural or Science related area  Minimum of 10+ year’s experience gained within a Life Sciences environment  Experience of working in a project environment  Hands on attitude  Excellent oral and written communication skills in English  High level of customer orientation/understanding  All applications will be treated in strictest confidence

WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DOIMC is a leading global market maker, using algorithmic trading and advanced technology to buy and sell securities on multiple trading venues worldwide. We provide liquidity to the financial markets, driving efficiencies for buyers and sellers.
Founded in 1989, we are an ambitious, innovative company and identified early on the importance technology would play in the fast-paced evolution of trading. This entrepreneurial spirit still drives us today and can be found in all of our offices around the world.
TRADING INFRASTRUCTURE AT IMC:We are a dynamic and international team of network and system engineers responsible for the management of our European IT infrastructure and the support of our trading operations in Europe. We are looking for an experienced hands-on Systems Engineer to join our team in Amsterdam.
The ideal candidate should have work experience in systems engineering, preferably with prior exposure to financial markets and with proven working knowledge in the fields of Linux administration, orchestration and automation tools, systems hardware architecture as well as storage, data protection and virtualization technologies.
As part of the Trading Infrastructure team, you will have the opportunity to interact and work closely with other systems and network engineers, traders, developers and technology vendors. You thrive on working in a high pace environment and on collaborating in cross-functional teams. The ability to clearly communicate - both verbally and written - technical concepts and challenges to both technical and non-technical stakeholders is a must.
The role comes with lots of flexibility and space for personal development and presents a great opportunity for those who aspire to learning new technical skills and widening their field of expertise. If you are enthusiastic about cutting edge technologies, proactive in your way of working, possess get-it-done attitude and feel comfortable taking ownership, we would like to hear from you!  
WHAT YOU WILL DO:Continuously improve and maintain our low latency Linux based trading and backend environmentManage and monitor all our distributed systems, big data solutions and storage infrastructureHeavy focus on systems automation, and CI/CD so we can deploy everything – hardware, software, solutions – rapidly and repeatableKeep up with the latest technology trends in the industry; propose, evaluate and implement new solutions
WHO YOU ARE:Advanced knowledge of Linux system administration and Linux internals; including services, networking, and file systemsSolid knowledge of cloud technologies, microservices and orchestration frameworksAdvanced experience with automated baremetal provisioning and systems configuration managementProven working experience with distributed, multi-tiered and high-performance storage technologiesSolid python and shell scripting skillsExperience using code versioning tools and CI tools (Git/TeamCity/Jenkins)Analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets is desirableDemonstrated talent for solving problems proactively and creatively, result orientedFast learner and excellent troubleshooterHigh degree of flexibility and adaptability – must feel comfortable in a dynamic working environment
WHAT MAKES IT FUN?IMC is on the cutting edge of financial applications, processing terabytes of data daily for mission-critical tradingWe always aim to use the right tools for the trade, regardless of hype. If something new can potentially bring an advantage we will often try, adopt and incorporate that new technology.We work end to end. In our Infrastructure team you will be involved in every stage of developing your solutions, from architecture to implementation. You are empowered to make decisions and improve the solution at every layer.The landscape is always changing creating new and exciting challenges. What we focus on today is very different than what we focused on two years ago.We really believe in sharing knowledge and technology between the different offices. Much of our technology stack is shared globally between our offices, and we provide opportunities to travel between the regions both for personal growth and to assist where it has the biggest impact.Working at IMC is a great way to gain exposure to and learn about financial markets and technology. We know from experience that a lot of people really enjoy learning about a field beyond their immediate area of expertise, it’s one of the things that makes this job more interesting than others
OUR CULTUREOur employees are our greatest asset so we give them lots of responsibility and the support they need to make a difference. Our flat structure fosters a culture of openness and collaboration, encouraging the sharing of ideas and knowledge. It makes no difference if you have been with us for three days or three years, the best idea wins.
While we work hard, we also have a lot of fun; whether solving complex challenges or in team building, leisure and sporting activities. IMC also enables its employees to contribute towards a better society through our foundation.
OUR HIRING PROCESSTo set you up for success, you can find our hiring process including tips on applying and interviewing with us on our website. Now it’s up to you! Apply today to start an amazing journey with IMC.

Job Description
The DC & Facility Engineer is responsible for the day to day operations of the sites. The job is to ensure that all critical facility plant is kept running (power, cooling, fire detection, fire extinction, security, site-access, heating, lighting...). This includes managing maintenance schedules, break-fix, upgrades and infrastructure projects. The role is also to provide service deliveries of collocation services, act as onsite customer liaison, supplier manager and on-call engineer for facility, field and DC (Hosting) operations.Main Responsibilities:
Carry out the daily facility and field activities associated with keeping the site up and running (99.999% SLA on power and cooling).Management of facility electrical and cooling upgrade projects (fixes, upgrades and improvements), as well as network build projects, for both internal and external customers.Act as key onsite contact (Single Point of Contact) for GTT NOC as needed for planned works and troubleshooting incidents.Work to provide solutions to pre-sales & bid management quotations for facility opportunities, working with third-party vendors where necessary.Work closely with Service Delivery and Sales to deliver new services as quickly and cleanly as possible.Install and commission equipment (including colocation & telecom racks, power/data & monitoring cabling, ODFs & patch panels, network devices, security and CCTV elements, plus any associated peripheral equipment.Supervise third party suppliers (FLM - First Line Maintenance) contractors including quote and bid management, performing annual maintenances, facility repairs & emergency, regular service reviews and resolving issues.Investigate root-cause-analysis for incidents (Reason-for-Outage 'post-mortems' ), writing up reports, including making propositions for service improvements and ensuring follow up on the implementation of changes.Ensure the data center is kept impeccably tidy at all times and any breaches are dealt with in a timely manner.The role includes on-call (on average one week a month) to provide first line response to facility, field and DC issues after hours.Ideal Candidate Profile:
Provide assistance for and act as backup to the onsite field engineer to keep the network running (patch & network installations, troubleshooting)To complete on time, field tasks including CPE installs, card installs, patching, testing using appropriate tools, analysis of test results, and basic problem handling and troubleshooting.Assist with “Construction Works” notifications for outside plant (fibre) works.Ensure personnel (staff, suppliers, customers) abide by the relevant processes and procedures (Health & Safety, security).Ensure all records and inventories are kept up-to-date (budget tracking, network inventories, logistics, site as-builds, electrical diagrams).Process data to provide reports and statistics to help forecast trends (workload, capacity, usage trends).Ensure management have adequate information and regular updates regarding pipeline projects and current/proposed workload.Act as key onsite liaison for all audits and statutory regulatory bodies (ISO, PCI, FINMA, Fire Department...).Manage site shipment deliveries (parcels, packages) for GTT as well as for customers (both incoming and outgoing). Maintain storage areas and stock management.Assist as interface with other departments including regular meetings such as the Change Control board, Infrastructure Log review, weekly site meetings, bi-weekly regional meeting, monthly facility review.Assist with general improvement by providing feedback on snags as well as challenging the process and systems and sharing ideas on ways to develop efficiency.Other tasks as may be required by management.Person Specification
We are looking for a mid to senior facility engineer profile. Someone who can show to work independently on power and cooling systems.Good interpersonal and communication skills.Team playerFlexible and adaptableEnglish and Dutch both written and orally.Enthusiastic and highly self-motivatedAppreciation of cultural differences and empathy to deal with difficult negotiations/situations.Willing to travel at short notice.Experience & skills Required
Prior experience in Data Center Industry with minimum 4 years working experience in Field Engineering/Operations and Facility Engineering.Strong knowledge of facility air conditioning systems.Strong experience with electrical systems (PDU, UPS, Generators & Switch Boards).Competence in electrical circuit diagrams and ability to intepret and update technical documentation.Strong analytical mindset, good troubleshooting methodology, calmness under pressure and attention to detail.Able to be comfortable designing basic power and cooling toplogies.Knowledge of networking (copper & fibre patching, IP & transmission systems such as IP, SDH and DWDM) a plus but not necessary.Work pattern:  Full time - standard office hoursLanguages required:   English and DutchOn Call required:        Yes

Axians groeit en is breed actief in de ICT! Op het gebied van ICT-infrastructuren richten we ons op datacommunicatie, security, telefonie en datacenter-oplossingen, waaronder Cloud-oplossingen en Desktop-virtualisatie. Vanwege groei zijn we op zoek naar een Services Consultant datacenter.

Wat je doet?

Als Services Consultant ben je onderdeel van de business unit Services die verantwoordelijk is voor het leveren van beheer- en supportwerkzaamheden. Dit betekent dat je verantwoordelijk bent voor alle datacenter omgevingen van onze klanten. Op deze manier ken jij alle ins en outs en kunnen we nog meer van toegevoegde waarde zijn voor onze klanten

Hoe ziet jouw uitdaging eruit?

Je bent een kenner van datacenter- en cloud oplossingen en begrijpt op welke wijze deze bijdragen aan de ambities van onze klanten. Eventuele knelpunten signaleer je tijdig en je geeft gevraagd en ongevraagd advies over de te nemen stappen vanuit ons beheer perspectief, via wijzigingen of nieuwe projecten. Bij verstoringen met een hoge klantimpact, bepaal jij met het team wat er voor nodig is om deze binnen de SLA-afspraken op te lossen. Je bent de senior in je vakgebied en een vraagbaak voor collega’s. Waar nodig spring je bij om met jouw inzichten de teamleden binnen je vakgebied te enthousiasmeren. Bij complexe wijzigingen en projecten wordt jouw expertise gevraagd; vanuit de klant of intern vanuit de business unit. Je speelt een sleutelrol bij het in beheer nemen van (delen van) infrastructuren van onze klanten. Je hebt een beeld bij ‘automatisering’ en hoe ons dit helpt om beheertaken te vereenvoudigen en waarde toe te voegen aan onze datacenterpropositie. Dienstverlening zit je in het bloed en je bent niet bang om een goed gesprek ‘over de inhoud’ te voeren met klanten en collega’s.

Wat vragen wij van jou?

Je beschikt minimaal over een HBO werk- en denkniveau, aangevuld met actuele datacenter certificeringen. Denk hierbij aan o.a. Microsoft producten, virtualisatie lagen, storage omgevingen en cloud infrastructuren (Azure, AWS);Je hebt een gedegen productkennis en bent in staat medewerkers te begeleiden, ondersteunen en motiveren;Je bent een creatieve teamspeler en uiteraard communicatief vaardig en weet op een resultaatgerichte manier je kennis over te dragen;Je bent gemotiveerd om jezelf en je carrière te ontwikkelen en ook je engineering-collega’s daarin mee te nemen;Je beschikt over minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring in een dienstverlenende organisatie, waardoor je ruime ervaring hebt in het beheren van datacenter infrastructuren en het oplossen van complexe vraagstukken;Je bent klant- en resultaatgericht, flexibel, accuraat en dienstverlenend.

Wat bieden wij jou?

Een goede werksfeer en korte communicatielijnen;Een afwisselende baan in een gestaag groeiende, professionele organisatie met marktconforme voorwaarden;Een fulltime dienstverband (36-40 uur per week);Goede opleidingsmogelijkheden aan de VINCI Energies Academy;Serieuze waardering en beloning voor jouw ontwikkeling en je bijdrage aan de groei van Axians;25 vakantiedagen, met de flexibele mogelijkheid meer dagen op te bouwen (bij een aanstelling van 36 – 40 uur per week);Prima secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden met o.a. een pensioenregeling en de mogelijkheid om aandelen te kopen tegen een gereduceerd tarief.

Wat als ik deze baan graag wil?

We willen je uitnodigen om via de solliciteerknop te reageren en je motivatiebrief en CV te uploaden. Wij gaan graag met je in gesprek om te kijken of we iets voor elkaar kunnen betekenen. Heb je vragen omtrent deze vacature dan kun je onze Recruiter, Jeff Koekebacker, bereiken op 06-51102156 of via jeff.koekebacker@axians.com.

Job Title: Chemical Trade & Sales - UK & Ireland markets
Company Name: ECEM European Chemical Marketing BV, Amsterdam
Job Description:
For our Amsterdam HQ we are looking for experienced native (British) English speaking Chemical Trade & Sales Professionals aimed at the UK & Ireland markets. You will be independently selling our full product range of chemical raw materials to (existing and new) clients and negotiating agreements. You will follow, respond to and report market trends and will be prepared to occasionally travel to destinations within the UK & Ireland.
ECEM (est. 1981) is a solid and independent company with a high reputation in the industry with specialised market knowledge and expertise. We are ranking amongst the top 50 chemical trading companies in Europe and the largest EU-distributor for a wide range of Acrylic, Methacrylic and Hydroxy monomers as well as a range of complementary specialties, used in amongst others: Coatings, Adhesive, Polyurethane and several other industries. We have distribution/supply agreements with many major chemical (Western and Asian) whereby our policy is to do business directly from producer to end-users. Customers are served form our own stocks in strategic locations.

﻿Primary responsibilitiesDistribution and sales of a variety of chemicals o.a. acrylic, methacrylic and special monomers and range of materials used in different industries, of which mainly the producers of resins and coatings.Ensure the agreed business is supplied 100% OTIF (in time in full).Resolve customer complaints by investigating problems; developing solutions; preparing reports, and making recommendations to management.Forecast sales (when possible) to enable operations planning and to introduce product innovations.Monitor competition (ex. in the coatings and adhesives industries) by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, new products, delivery schedules, merchandizing techniques.Keep management informed by submitting activity and results reports, such as daily call reports, weekly work plans, and monthly and annual territory analysis.Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending trade shows, establishing personal networks; attending the occasional educational workshops and reviewing professional publications. 
ExperienceNative (British) English, complimented with Dutch at a conversional (minimum B1) level. Additional languages (German, French, Spanish, Italian) might be an asset.Experience in the international trade of mainly liquid chemicals in Isotanks and managing supply chains.Currently residing at commuting distance of our office in Amsterdam (near Amsterdam Arena) and fulltime available.Proven track record in sales and trade to end-users in the chemical industry to major B2B end users in (parts of) Great Britain and Ireland.Preferable experienced with international (in-bound) logistics in a distribution company.Proven track-record in selling, visiting and (cold) calling for new business development. Idem maintaining and building relationships with existing and new customers to expand the business.Self-starter, who can work independently and ask for support, if necessary.Strong ability to independently determine priorities and solve problems.Knowledge of import, storage and distribution and chemical trade (EU) regulations.Proven ability to be responsible for the profitability of business.Strong analytical skills, curious, structured and accurate and able to work in a competitive environment.Well experienced in MS Office, experienced with any ERP system and easily picking up new automation systems.

WE WILL ONLY BE ACCEPTING APPLICATIONS FROM CANDIDATES CURRENTLY RESIDENT WITHIN THE EUROPEAN UNION, WITH AN UNRESTRICTED RIGHT TO WORK IN THE NETHERLANDS.
Our Offer
This is a great opportunity for anyone ready to join an agile strong international company with nearly 40 years’ proven track record of global growth, very well established in Europe, with a global presence.Work processes are entrepreneurial and interpersonal compared to the large(r) and structured chemical companies. Our company advantage comes from strategic global sourcing while quickly developing new sales opportunities flexibility to meet the ever-changing needs in the marketplace. Remuneration in accordance with results achieved, and bonus scheme based on profit results is available.
Acquisition on basis of this vacancy is NOT wanted NOR appreciated.

Please feel free to apply even though you do NOT HAVE specifically Golang experience! ..as being a senior engineer with a growth mindset we believe you could easily learn on the job;)
WHO WE AREAfter the 2008 financial crash, the international financial and business environment is more regulated than ever. The amount of required paperwork has increased exponentially. The deals are being blocked, the accounts are being frozen, the business is often getting paralyzed. Project Plato was born in 2015 as an autonomous R&D unit working for Dolfin, an established British investment company, with the aim of automating sensitive business operations. We are a young and ambitious team frustrated by inefficiency of existing solutions.
5 years later, with the help of our software solutions, Dolfin was able to have:$4.1bn in client assets under management$650m monthly brokerage flow10x increased speed of customer and employee onboarding30x more efficiency of its compliance officers
But this is only the beginning. Our mission is to help companies and business professionals around the world communicate with each other and do business with trust and simplified paperwork.
OUR TECH STACKAs a serious, business-oriented company, we develop our solutions exclusively in COBOL.Just kidding! We use modern and diverse IT infrastructure. Our solutions are web-based, with 90% of our backend code in Golang, some bits in Python and frontends in Typescript and React. Data storages include PostgreSQL, DynamoDB and Amazon S3. The infrastructure consists of multiple backend services managed via Kubernetes/Helm, integrated with various AWS and third-party services. We also use Google Bazel, a secure and robust build system.
We strive to make our development process predictable, change-proof and well-organized to achieve the fastest possible product delivery pace without compromising reliability.
OUR TEAMWe are still small: Project Plato is less than 15 people in total but we are planning to grow to 20 soon. As part of the Project Plato back-end team, you will be working closely with Oleg and another 3 senior engineers. Oleg is our lead backend engineer who has been part of the team since 2015 when we established our office in Amsterdam. We are a group that values trust, growth, agility, mutual respect, taking ownership, and learning from each other through a culture of open feedback.
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FORYou have a math or computer science background. No diplomas needed, but knowing your graphs and big-Os is a must.You know your way around web services. Parlez-vous HTTP? Veux-tu un cookie?You know well at least TWO of: Golang, Python, C++, Java/C#, Typescript.You are familiar with modern build systems (especially code generation), Unix-based operating systems, Docker/Kubernetes and cloud services.You are a self-learner. You can analyze the code and documentation yourself, and you can ask questions when needed. Our team is small and focused, and we do not have spare time for thorough tutoring :(You are passionate about quality and reliability. This is not a social media app startup, we deal with big money and strict regulations.You are able to take honest and direct feedback and openly discuss the problems.You are not afraid of complex problem domains.Knowledge of frontend technologies is a plus.
WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DOBuild and improve web applications for our customers using our frameworks and libraries.Ensure the application architecture allows easy maintenance and support.Tune the application performance by optimizing queries, storage and algorithms.Integrate the applications with 3rd party services (AWS-based and others).Work with our customers to define business rules using our domain-specific languages.Maintain and improve our build and automation infrastructure.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOUModern technological stack.Challenging projects with enough possibilities for personal development.Freedom to do what you do best.Flexible work schedule.Working in a team of the most senior developers with high standards and looking out for the most efficient solutions.Personal development budget, chance to attend courses and conferences abroad.Top-notch work equipment.25 days of holidays.Above market rate salary.Culture of learning, agility, innovation and open feedback.Optional relocation to Amsterdam + Visa sponsorship if needed.
If you have any questions, please contact our tech recruiter Kristina at https://www.linkedin.com/in/kristinajavurkovahr/ (WhatsApp +31640729123)
Or just apply right now!
We are proud that your agency wants to work with us, but we don’t collaborate with third parties to fulfill this role and other tech vacancies. Thank you for understanding.
